commit_message:
py37: drop use of 'async' as parameter name

Python 3.7 does not allow the use of 'async' as
a parameter name or object attribute; update
occurrences to use a different name.

This is inline with PEP-492, where await and async
are keywords.

Change-Id: I73efcafab1e0832a0ada95f6c12cb6a659dfcf27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/43/580343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, conf, use_async=False): self.use_async = use_async flags = zmq.NOBLOCK if self.use_async else 0
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, conf, async=False): self.async = async flags = zmq.NOBLOCK if self.async else 0

commit_message:
Implement fetching of networks

This uses the list_networks workflow.  We also add the necessary
infrastructure for storing network data in the global state.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-configure-networks
Change-Id: I274d247d52be896c37b18b4d808b1ae81c35fb5d

commit_message:
replace cmp with total_ordering decorator

The cmp() built-in is no longer available under python 3 and the
__cmp__ method is not used. Remove __cmp__ and __ne__ and add a __lt__
method and use the functools.total_ordering decorator to provide all
of the rich comparison methods for StoreLocations.

Change-Id: Iae1d0c27bd82a42c80fc98f87c9b85edef527c51
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/27/573027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools@functools.total_ordering def __lt__(self, other): return self.value < self.__cast(other)
deleted_lines: def __cmp__(self, other): return cmp(self.value, self.__cast(other)) def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Move unset_flavor_extra_specs to extra specs file

Flavor unset extra spec schema 'unset_flavor_extra_specs'
is present in flavors.py schema file which should be in
flavors_extra_specs.py file.

Change-Id: Ibea6081129ce05e300b3dc757fabdbed2d3e0570

commit_message:
Rename --endpoint-override to --os-endpoint-override

The ``--endpoint-override`` command line argument has been deprecated.
It is renamed to ``--os-endpoint-override`` to avoid misinterpreting
command line arguments.
It defaults to the ``OS_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE`` environment variable.

The deprecated ``--bypass-url`` command line argument has been removed.

Change-Id: Ic8a6559cd62d46b837fa9c04b482a46ceba829db
Closes-Bug: #1778536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/91/580991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--os-endpoint-override', default=utils.env('OS_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE', 'NOVACLIENT_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE', "Defaults to env[OS_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE]."))
deleted_lines: '--endpoint-override', default=utils.env('NOVACLIENT_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE', "Defaults to env[NOVACLIENT_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE].")) parser.add_argument( '--bypass-url', action=DeprecatedAction, use=_('use "%s"; this option will be removed after Pike OpenStack ' 'release.') % '--os-endpoint-override', dest='endpoint_override', help=argparse.SUPPRESS)

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Use Neutron ovs_lib for MPLS OVS

* Use Neutron agent ovs_lib.OVSBridge class to manage MPLS OVS dataplane instead
  of directly running ovs-vsctl and ovs-ofctl shell commands.
* Use OpenFlow groups and buckets to manage load-balancing and add group and
  bucket identifier allocators.
* Extend ovs_lib.OVSBridge add_flow and delete_flows methods to accept list of
  dicts for flow matches and a list of actions parameters.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Id8f5318746cdee507beb112ba69800a43c7f6f20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/47/559747/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_bagpipe.bagpipe_bgp.common import dataplane_utilsfrom neutron.agent.common import ovs_lib from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.common import \ constants as ovs_const VRF_REGISTER = '0' return prefix if prefix_length != 0 else None self.ovs_vlan = None self.bridge.delete_flows(table=table, cookie=self._cookie(add=False)) (self.bridge.br_name, remote_ip), remote_ip, self.bridge.br_name) (remote_ip, self.bridge.br_name)) # - OVS port name try: port_name = "" port = self.bridge.add_port(port_name) return (port, port_name) def _vlan_match(self): return {'dl_vlan': self.ovs_vlan} if self.ovs_vlan else {} def get_push_vlan_action(self): return ("push_vlan:0x8100,mod_vlan_vid:%d," % self.ovs_vlan if self.ovs_vlan else "") def get_strip_vlan_action(self): return "strip_vlan," if self.ovs_vlan else "" actions = '%soutput:%d' % (self.get_push_vlan_action(), self.fallback.get('ovs_port_number')) self.bridge.add_flow(table=self.driver.vrf_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=FALLBACK_PRIORITY, mod_dl_src=self.fallback.get('src_mac'), mod_dl_dst=self.fallback.get('dst_mac'), actions=actions, **self._vrf_match()) 'vlan_action': self.get_push_vlan_action(), flow_match = self._vrf_match() flow_match.update({'arp_tpa': self.gateway_ip}) self.bridge.add_flow(table=self.driver.vrf_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=DEFAULT_RULE_PRIORITY, proto='arp', dl_dst='ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff', arp_op='0x1', actions=actions, **flow_match) self.bridge.delete_flows(table=self.driver.vrf_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=False), proto='arp', **self._vrf_match()) def _check_vlan_use(self, localport): # for all interfaces plugged into the VRF try: ovs_vlan = int(localport['ovs']['vlan']) except KeyError: return if self.ovs_vlan is None: self.ovs_vlan = ovs_vlan if self.ovs_vlan != ovs_vlan: "%s vs %s", self.ovs_vlan, ovs_vlan) (ovs_port, ovs_port_name) = self._get_ovs_port_specifics(localport) self._check_vlan_use(localport) self.get_strip_vlan_action(), self.instance_id, VRF_REGISTER, for proto in ('ip', 'arp'): self.bridge.add_flow(table=self.driver.input_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=DEFAULT_RULE_PRIORITY, proto=proto, in_port=ovs_port, actions=actions, **self._vlan_match()) (self.get_push_vlan_action(), GATEWAY_MAC, self.bridge.add_flow( table=self.driver.encap_in_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=DEFAULT_RULE_PRIORITY, proto="mpls", mpls_label=label, mpls_bos=1, actions="pop_mpls:0x0800,%s" % incoming_actions) self.bridge.add_flow( table=self.driver.encap_in_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=DEFAULT_RULE_PRIORITY, in_port=self.driver.vxlan_tunnel_port_number, tun_id=label, actions=incoming_actions) "ovs_port": ovs_port, "ovs_port_name": ovs_port_name, } ovs_port = self._ovs_port_info[localport['linuxif']]['ovs_port'] ovs_port_name = self._ovs_port_info[ localport['linuxif']]['ovs_port_name'] self.bridge.delete_flows(table=self.driver.encap_in_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=False), proto="mpls", mpls_label=label, mpls_bos=1) self.bridge.delete_flows( table=self.driver.encap_in_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=False), in_port=self.driver.vxlan_tunnel_port_number, tun_id=label) self.bridge.delete_flows(table=self.driver.input_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=False), in_port=ovs_port, **self._vlan_match()) if ovs_port_name: self.bridge.delete_port(ovs_port_name) return "%d%s" % (self.instance_id, mask) def _vrf_match(self): return {VRF_REGISTER: self.instance_id} def _update_lb_buckets(self, prefix): buckets = [] buckets.append("bucket=%s", join_s(dec_ttl_action, label_action, output_action)) self.bridge.mod_group(group_id=self.instance_id, type='select', selection_method='dp_hash', buckets=','.join(buckets)) self.bridge.add_flow(table=self.driver.vrf_table, cookie=self._cookie(add=True), priority=_priority_from_prefix(prefix), nw_dst=_match_from_prefix(prefix), actions="group:%d" % self.instance_id) self.log.debug("buckets: %s", buckets) if prefix not in self._lb_endpoints: self._update_lb_buckets(prefix) if self._lb_endpoints[prefix]: self._update_lb_buckets(prefix) self.bridge.delete_group(group_id=self.instance_id) flow_match = dict() if classifier.source_pfx: flow_match.update({'nw_src': classifier.source_pfx}) if classifier.destination_pfx: flow_match.update({'nw_dst': classifier.destination_pfx}) mask = 65535 - (port_max - port_min) flow_match.update({'tp_src': port_min + '/' + mask}) else: commit_message:
Add support for NodeDataLookup for Ceph deployment

Restores compatibility with NodeDataLookup parameter for the
deployment of Ceph via config-download.

Change-Id: I06764271adb73ba73e15e3f7d8d553532db727ef
Closes-Bug: 1778617

include this release as per
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/releasing.html#things-to-do-before-releasing

commit_message:
PXE Filter dnsmasq: manage macs not in ironic

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it keeps
macs that are no longer in ironic blacklisted unless
introspection is active or node_not_found_hook is set.

Replacing the previous behaviour that would
exclusively whitelist macs that are no longer in
ironic.

Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
(cherry picked from commit c4abd6783bd40f39736b62f9fffd95f6af4b8a04)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/31/580931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The ``dnsmasq`` PXE filter no longer whitelists the MAC addresses of ports deleted from the Bare Metal service. Instead they are blacklisted unless introspection is active or the ``node_not_found_hook`` is set in the configuration. This ensures that no previously enrolled node accidentally boot the inspection image when no node introspection is active. `Bug #2001979 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001979>`_.

commit_message:
Make profiler.clean() public method

Horizon dashboard has a profiler plugin which calls profiler.init
method at
 openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/profiler/middleware.py
line 64. This creates a profiler and picks a new base_id. The only
way to remove this profiler and stop using this base_id is to call
profiler._clean() method. So this patch changes _clean() to clean()
so it becomes a public method.

Change-Id: Idec7ee240bc7f508aeebcba374a9673652b1cc72
Related-Bug: #1777486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/62/578362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: profiler.clean()

Clarifications to API & Scenario Tests

Installation of tempest itself and the installation of the
keystone-tempest-plugin is missing from the description.
This change adds them.

Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
move lookup of provider from _new_allocations()

Following patches will be heavily modifying the allocation handler's
_new_allocations() helper function, so this patch pulls part of that
function's purpose -- checking that resource provider UUIDs in the
allocation payload refer to existing resource providers -- out into a
separate helper function, thus reducing the size of the coming patches.

Change-Id: I2875a431726c5248b1522d28542b627d07856a39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/579920/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Detect skip version upgrades from version earlier than Pike

When performing a skip version upgrade from a release earlier than Pike,
Ironic will crash when check_versions cannot find the 'version' columns
in the database.

This change adds a safety check which detects old database
version missing the 'version' columns. Instead of crashing, it will
inform the user that skip version upgrades are not supported and
that database migrations need to be run for each skipped versions instead.

Story: 2002558
Task: 22122
Change-Id: Ifa100c6fd168fc59b56bba0c41836958b10f2d47

commit_message:
Add annotation to allow any file size in ingress

This change add the "nginx.org/proxy-max-temp-file-size" value
to the ingress chart's values file, sets it to "0" to
disable temp file caching, and allows serving files of any size.

Change-Id: I536ad98585e0270e033db2bc85d448981b3cfd90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/04/577004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove incorrect filter on listing subnets

The test case uses 'admin_state_up' as a filter parameter on listing
subnets, but this is an invalid filter since the subnet resource
doesn't have this attribute. This patch removes this filter.

Change-Id: I3f2e6e861adaeef81a1a5819a57b28f5c6281d80
Related-Bug: #1749820
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/67/575467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 01:28:03.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone-tempest-plugin/commit/4dbc50b4e084592d631402cbe23785c8154e66fc', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dbb16f6fb0b3e4e3932e0c26569d55208f39ee4
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dbb16f6fb0b3e4e3932e0c26569d55208f39ee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-tempest-plugin refs/changes/62/573862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Add support for rbd user

Read the rbd_user from the [powervm] section in the conf file.
Use the rbd_user when creating an rbd object. This user id will be
used when trying to connect to the rbd cluster.

Change-Id: I4548eff8afa85e63a8ca40d819298dccffe63e26

commit_message:
Bump pypowervm min 1.1.16

1.1.16 is required for a proposed change [1].

We also add a new lower-constraints.txt and start using that instead
of the one from nova so that we can indicate a more recent pypowervm
minimum. The file is otherwise identical to nova at this point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573837/

Change-Id: I133370a33afe5e3cababba187459ab28838582eb

commit_message:
Pin networking-cisco build sphinx docs to stable/queens

Until neutron Rocky beta is released we can not install neutron newer
than queens from pypi so we need to pin this job to stable/queens so the
upper contraints used are the queens upper contraints.

Change-Id: Ib487f72daf767023ce543657a355e9aa72c01515

commit_message:
Correct log path and set handler

The journalbeat process was restarting every playbook run which was not
required. This change moves the restart process to a handler which will
ensure we're not restarting the services when it's not required.

Change-Id: I4c0082d04d99c71c902ae39ee5ad9efc5074889f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add spec for consuming context attributes for policy

A use case came up in Denver during the Queens PTG for external
policy enforcement, which was implemented in Queens. During the Rocky
PTG, it became apparent that external enforcement is hard when
different attributes are sent by different services. This spec
attempts to help address that issue by laying out the necessary
steps for oslo.policy to consume oslo.context objects, resulting
in less duplicate information.

bp policy-enforcement-with-context

Change-Id: Ide634c5ab3454fe8bf9097c747b692e3e86b85c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/45/552045/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================== Consistent Policy Enforcement Attributes ======================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=consistent-policy-attributes This specification details the work required to make policy decisions based on a consistent set of attributes from a service. Problem description =================== The oslo.policy library is used by most OpenStack services to make authoritative decisions about what a user can do. This decision is done when a service calls the ``enforce()`` method on an instance of oslo.policy's ``Enforcer`` object. A service can optionally supply addition information to ``enforce`` by using the ``creds`` and ``target`` arguments. These arguments are dictionaries that are supposed to contain as much information about the user making the request (``creds``) and the resource involved in the policy decision (``target``). This design makes it tough to guarantee specific attributes are *always* present. This not only changes when ``enforce`` is called to protect different APIs in the same service, but different services might not even pass in the same attributes, or reference them consistently. This can make things difficult, if not impossible, for operators looking to implement fine-grained custom policy checks or invoke an `external policy enforcement point <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/queens/external-pdp.html>`_. Proposed change =============== Let's agree on a basic set of attributes that should be present in each call to ``enforce()``. Once we have that list specified, we can implement checks in ``enforce()`` that expect them to always be present. Since this would be a backwards incompatible change, and might break services, the release this change is included in should be a new major version of the oslo.policy library. Once a new library is available for services to consume, we can iteratively step through each service and help them populate the missing fields. After that, operators that need to write custom policy checks or invoking external policy enforcement points should be able to rely on that information consistently. The following are the proposed additional attributes to check for in the ``creds`` dictionary: * ``user_id``: The unique identifier of the user making the request. This is typically handled by keystonemiddleware and oslo.context. * ``project_id``: The unique identifier of the project the users is acting upon. This is typically handled by keystonemiddleware and oslo.context. * ``domain_id``: The unique identifier of the domain being acted upon. This is typically handled by keystonemiddleware and oslo.context. The following are the proposed additional attributes to check for in the ``target`` dictionary: * ``resource_id``: The unique identifier of the resource involved in the request (e.g. nova instance ID, glance image ID, cinder volume ID, etc). Alternatives ------------ One other way to achieve cross-project consistency would be to use an OpenStack Community Goal. This would likely be a longer process, and not something we could get started until Rocky development is complete and the TC starts voting on community goals for the next release. Even after that, there still remains a task to go and educate projects about the change and implement it. Semantic versioning does this naturally without requiring a community wide goal. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- Any call to the ``enforce()`` or ``authorize()`` methods will need to be populated with the correct attributes, specified in the above section. Otherwise an exception will be raised. The exception isn't necessarily intended for end users, but developers consuming the new version of oslo.policy. Security impact --------------- There will be some additional information available in the arguments to ``enforce()``, but nothing that is overly security sensitive. Performance Impact ------------------ The performance impact should be negligible since oslo.policy is really just marshaling data through a method. It can be included in an actual check if the operator writes a policy the expects it. Configuration Impact -------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- Developers might notice failures from oslo.policy when consuming the new version, which can be remedied by adjusting the service to always pass the expected attributes to ``enforce()``. Testing Impact -------------- The addition of attribute checking in oslo.policy will require some additional testing, primarily unit testing. The alternative would require some level of integration testing to make sure services pass the right information into oslo.policy. That might not be required if oslo.policy does the checking and raises and exception if the attributes are missing. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com> lbragstad Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: rocky-2 Work Items ---------- * Implement specific attribute checks in ``enforce()`` * Release a new major version of oslo.policy * Work with services that fail with the new version Documentation Impact ==================== New documentation will need to be written that describes how and what attributes to populate when using the new major version of oslo.policy. Dependencies ============ None. References ========== None.

commit_message:
switch incorrect python3 docs job to correct one

We are replacing publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-python3 with
publish-openstack-docs-pti.

Change-Id: I581df5a76d7a656732796f2414c46d94a4f23ff7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580485
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
define publish-openstack-docs-pti project template

As part of the python3-first goal, we need to update the PTI to
restore the ability to use tox to run the documentation build
commands. This will give us a way to configure each repo to have its
dependencies installed properly and to change the version of python
used in a self-testing patch to the tox.ini file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580484
Change-Id: If87a3c80bed8dbbe9a93a6350056338e97d98162
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

added_lines: name: openstack-tox-docs parent: openstack-tox description: | Run documentation build. Uses tox with the ``docs`` environment. vars: tox_envlist: docs - job:

commit_message:
Fix KeyError if a deprecated key is given

It happens when a deprecated key is given(i.e. os-auth-ver). The service shall
change the reference before calling oslo.config.

Change-Id: I841f027f90e353b7ea5e1ec059286e8fa9b94f49
Closes-Bug: #1774722
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/50/575950/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except KeyError: ori_opt, ori_group = CONF._find_deprecated_opts(config_key) if '-' in ori_opt: ori_opt = ori_opt.replace('-', '_') CONF.set_override(ori_opt, conf.default[config_key])

commit_message:
Add support for configuring ppc64le nodes

The aim of this change to the enable puppet-ironic as used by tripleo to
configure ironic and the tftp services in a way that "just works" with
tripleo.

It adds the ability to tweak ironic's command retry and spacing values
as well as creating architecture specific config and bootfile mappings

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ia64dd21b55474d402315ba7c05e28604fff3aea8

Adds a function to nova/objects/resource_provider.py that returns the
usage records by provider and resource class for all providers in the
requested provider trees (that have matching inventory of the requested
resource classes).

This is a complementary function to the existing
_get_usages_by_provider_and_rc() function that is used to get the same
usage records for non-nested scenarios.

commit_message:
add _get_usages_from_trees() function

Adds a function to nova/objects/resource_provider.py that returns the
usage records by provider and resource class for all providers in the
requested provider trees (that have matching inventory of the requested
resource classes).

This is a complementary function to the existing
_get_usages_by_provider_and_rc() function that is used to get the same
usage records for non-nested scenarios.

Change-Id: I198579e6b5870b95cf9881aab8ef8f1cad218fa4
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/534967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_usages_from_trees(self): """Tests that the return from _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc_from_trees() is correctly filtering the usage data based on the supplied provider tree IDs. """ # We set up 3 trees of providers that look like this: # # compute node (cn) # / \ # / \ # numa cell 0 numa cell 1 # | | # | | # pf 0 pf 1 cn_names = [] for x in ('1', '2', '3'): name = 'cn' + x cn_name = name cn_names.append(cn_name) cn = self._create_provider(name) _add_inventory(cn, fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, 16) _add_inventory(cn, fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, 32768) name = 'cn' + x + '_numa0' numa_cell0 = self._create_provider(name, parent=cn.uuid) name = 'cn' + x + '_numa1' numa_cell1 = self._create_provider(name, parent=cn.uuid) name = 'cn' + x + '_numa0_pf0' pf0 = self._create_provider(name, parent=numa_cell0.uuid) _add_inventory(pf0, fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 8) name = 'cn' + x + '_numa1_pf1' pf1 = self._create_provider(name, parent=numa_cell1.uuid) _add_inventory(pf1, fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 8) VCPU_ID = fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.VCPU) SRIOV_NET_VF_ID = fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF) usages = rp_obj._get_usages_from_trees(self.ctx, [1], [VCPU_ID]) self.assertEqual(1, len(usages)) usage = usages[0] self.assertEqual(uuids.cn1, usage['resource_provider_uuid']) self.assertEqual(VCPU_ID, usage['resource_class_id']) self.assertEqual(16, usage['total']) self.assertEqual(0, usage['reserved']) self.assertIsNone(usage['used']) # Now check that if we ask for SRIOV_NET_VFs, with the first root # provider ID, that we indeed get back the two PFs usages = rp_obj._get_usages_from_trees(self.ctx, [1], [SRIOV_NET_VF_ID]) self.assertEqual(2, len(usages)) prov_uuids = [r['resource_provider_uuid'] for r in usages] exp_uuids = [uuids.cn1_numa0_pf0, uuids.cn1_numa1_pf1] self.assertEqual(exp_uuids, prov_uuids)

commit_message:
Deprecate nova::logging params in ::nova

Deprecates the parameters in ::nova that should be set
directly in the ::nova::logging class.

We can then remove all the messy pick() calls and backward
compatibility when this has been deprecated for a cycle. [1] [2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/e211fcfd65f3e1144ca9c29ff7314597e0989abc/manifests/logging.pp#L122-L130
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L531

Change-Id: I0fb2def264bd72101612291708df26f143183c8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/13/580213/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Granular requests to get_allocation_candidates

nova.scheduler.utils.ResourceRequest now has a to_querystring method
that produces a querystring in the format expected by the GET
/allocation_candidates API.  The report client now uses this method to
invoke said API.

Change-Id: I496e8d64907fdcb0e2da255725aed1fc529725f2
blueprint: granular-resource-requests

commit_message:
Fix openstack CLI calls environment when using venv

Without this fix the calls to openstack CLI will
return code 2 + error 'No such file or directories'
because the virtual env has not been propagated as
part of the execution PATH

Furthermore this is quite disturbing due to the fact
that some of the failing tasks are marked as
ignore_errors: true.

Change-Id: Iadd3ec14bfd4765488937ea7aa64d296fb129988

commit_message:
Fix uwsgi configuration when using venv

Without this fix, the following step will fail
bifrost-ironic-install : Ensure service project is present
and you will have errors in uwsgi like

...: Traceback (most recent call last):
...:   File "/var/www/keystone/public", line 6, in <module>
...:     from keystone.server.wsgi import initialize_public_application
...: ImportError: No module named keystone.server.wsgi

(extracted from journalctl -u uwsgi output)

Change-Id: If238ceb3d6309e491235aa63e1adccd7d0606be3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/31/580131/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uwsgi_venv: "{{ bifrost_venv_env.get('VIRTUAL_ENV', '') }}"

subject: remove restrictions on repos allowed to use publish-openstack-tox-docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-05 20:00:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/c281cfe18285381e7e42e1f876d5e47b6dd474fd', 'message': 'remove restrictions on repos allowed to use publish-openstack-tox-docs

We want to use publish-openstack-tox-docs as part of the PTI for

commit_message:
remove restrictions on repos allowed to use publish-openstack-tox-docs

We want to use publish-openstack-tox-docs as part of the PTI for
building documentation for all projects, so we need to allow all
projects to use it.

Change-Id: I718397cd51d43220e5226e8f88b7db699ea01bdd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove typo in the documentation

While YAML allow 4 spaces to define a dict, being consistent
with two spaces provides clarity for the deployer.

commit_message:
Change ceph caps to profile rbd

Based on the documentation [1] and this
bug [2] we should set caps for ceph keys
that use RBD to use the profile.

As we can see in the bug [2] setting it to wrong
can have cause very bad issues, this should direct
as a guideline since we will not hit this in CI.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1773449

Change-Id: I3767645807279afac77c1c367a70af6f0f9f4084
(cherry picked from commit 70cb017808e2f783bcb7fdeb782ef5553036e6eb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/95/579995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'cap_mon' => 'profile rbd', 'cap_osd' => 'profile rbd pool=cinder, profile rbd pool=nova, profile rbd pool=glance, profile rbd pool=gnocchi',
deleted_lines: 'cap_mon' => 'allow r', 'cap_osd' => 'allow class-read object_prefix rbd_children, allow rwx pool=cinder, allow rwx pool=nova, allow rwx pool=glance, allow rwx pool=gnocchi',

commit_message:
Add compute microversion 2.61 schema in flavors_client

Compute microversion 2.61 adds 'extra_specs' in flavor APIs response
This commit fill the schema gap for that.

Change-Id: Id1f1e51fbae1cc3d0c9efdcd9009f384745915d6

commit_message:
Expose power sync parameters

A busy environment is likely to tune these parameters, let's expose them.

Conflicts:
	manifests/conductor.pp

Change-Id: Ide6de7f7a147e15b2941706f282455baa9d8f671
(cherry picked from commit 5310a06d4611ede31980e08cf1662ef1beaaad6f)

commit_message:
Add base Dockerfile and supporting scripts

Story: 2001694
Task: 12491

Change-Id: I81e0d0ecbb431ed7e26fcbcb4d347ac164c66736
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common refs/changes/91/558791/52 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh # This script will return 0 when on specific address (like 192.168.10.6:5000) # scanning will reveal that port is responding. # # Example usage: # ./wait-for.sh 192.168.10.6:5000 && ./start_service.sh : "${WAIT_RETRIES:=5}" : "${WAIT_INTERVAL:=2}" wait_for() { echo "Waiting for $1 to listen on $2..." for i in $(seq $WAIT_RETRIES) do nc -z "$1" "$2" && return echo "$1 not yet ready (attempt $i of $WAIT_RETRIES)" sleep "$WAIT_INTERVAL" done echo "$1 failed to become ready, exiting..." exit 1 } for var in "$@" do host=${var%:*} port=${var#*:} wait_for "$host" "$port" done

properly configure the dns name for the hosts file generation

commit_message:
Moving more utils to ProviderUsageBaseTestCase

The I55edd2c6e4c752dbe675b6d51d71a047bf49597a refactor created a base class
for test cases that are checking allocations. This patch moves additional util
functions from the ServerMovingTest class to the base. The subsequent patch
covering soft delete cases needs these utils for non server moving tests.

Also the utils are made more generic to handle arbitrary number of compute
services. For this to work the setUp of the existing test classes needed
a small enhancement too.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I89e2682c9210901cf1992dac2f9068b51f0373cd in Pike.

Change-Id: I8430d39b8e8147731080e76f14a1a2b809c9863c
(cherry picked from commit 6c49c2c8fc4b04138e09c7b2feb5e996d9ef3d8c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/580490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Subclasses must define a **computes** dict with host: compute service key value pairs. def _boot_and_check_allocations(self, flavor, source_hostname): """Boot an instance and check that the resource allocation is correct After booting an instance on the given host with a given flavor it asserts that both the providers usages and resource allocations match with the resources requested in the flavor. It also asserts that running the periodic update_available_resource call does not change the resource state. :param flavor: the flavor the instance will be booted with :param source_hostname: the name of the host the instance will be booted on :return: the API representation of the booted instance """ server_req = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( self.api, 'some-server', flavor_id=flavor['id'], image_uuid='155d900f-4e14-4e4c-a73d-069cbf4541e6', networks=[]) server_req['availability_zone'] = 'nova:%s' % source_hostname LOG.info('booting on %s', source_hostname) created_server = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) server = self._wait_for_state_change( self.admin_api, created_server, 'ACTIVE') # Verify that our source host is what the server ended up on self.assertEqual(source_hostname, server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) # Before we run periodics, make sure that we have allocations/usages # only on the source host source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(flavor, source_usages) # Check that the other providers has no usage for rp_uuid in [self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(hostname) for hostname in self.computes.keys() if hostname != source_hostname]: usages = self._get_provider_usages(rp_uuid) self.assertEqual({'VCPU': 0, 'MEMORY_MB': 0, 'DISK_GB': 0}, usages) # commit_message:
Fix Non-unique network names in Servers IPs API response

Original spec change mixed two distinct API paths.
This change fixes the spec to address each path.
As a result, responses shall be fixed for server API paths:

 - GET /servers/detail
 - GET /servers/{server_id}
 - GET /servers/{server_id}/ips
 - PUT /servers/{server_id}
 - POST /servers/{server_id}/action (rebuild)

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint servers-ips-non-unique-network-names

Partial-Bug: #1708316
Change-Id: I6a0ca905996a50a6953e3932cf2636804d53a407
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

commit_message:
Add python3 to bindep

We recently switched to using python3, so let's add the files to
bindep.txt as well so that the packages get installed if needed.

Note this is a nop in OpenStack CI since python3 is available already.
But this is important to document dependencies.

Change-Id: Ic6c1c9adcec938c0db4f207d1d8e523e96ffe740

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie8f95d33a62e1c5c1437f24c6d02c6a8167e83e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
tox: Silence warnings from stdlib libraries

These are issues with Python 3 libraries so we can't fix them here.
Simply silence them.

Change-Id: I2bbabc5452257d98ba7da2a6a95bc9926202a9fd

commit_message:
vlan and linux_bond members for contrail vrouter

Currently the contrail vrouter interface member interface can
only be of type interface. vlan and linux_bond are needed,

Change-Id: I3e7cf56b0c237a8b791fedbeb255beb60ce3d7c6

commit_message:
Fix versions Controller for Py3

the webob's Response.body in fact accepts only bytes,
so under Python3 an attempt to assign a text value to webob's response.body
produces the following exception:

TypeError: You cannot set Response.body to a text object (use
Response.text)

Change-Id: I6352ec0662441dab039f15b35c8383e6d7d3dc78
Story: 2002531
Task: 22076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/35/574335/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: response.text = body

commit_message:
Merge server create for security group extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for security group extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky
Note- unit tests will be moved to test_serversV21 when we will merge
the extended response for security group.

Change-Id: I447947e23451d3898a5eee0e25facc3d9ae8c01e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/578714/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: security_groups = server_dict.get('security_groups') if security_groups is not None: create_kwargs['security_groups'] = [ sg['name'] for sg in security_groups if sg.get('name')] create_kwargs['security_groups'] = list( set(create_kwargs['security_groups']))

commit_message:
Merge server create for user data extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for user data extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I138b1ec4d14275b45922f6542e5f942d4615b916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/578709/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: create_kwargs['user_data'] = server_dict.get('user_data')

commit_message:
Update keystone-paste.ini to drop v2

We no longer support Identity v2 API, so we can also drop the
corresponding entries from keystone-paste.ini. Not sure why keystone
hasn't done the same thing upstream yet, it is done though in devstack
[0].

[0] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/keystone#n217

Change-Id: Iea57b6b5a85221f8a401c04680c1d0f0674edf33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/55/579855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This specifies the pipeline of the keystone V3 API,
deleted_lines: # This specify the pipeline of the keystone public API, # all Identity public API requests will be processed by the order of the pipeline. # this value will be used in the templated version of keystone-paste.ini # The last item in this pipeline must be public_service or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter. default['openstack']['identity']['pipeline']['public_api'] = 'healthcheck cors sizelimit http_proxy_to_wsgi url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension public_service' # This specify the pipeline of the keystone admin API, # all Identity admin API requests will be processed by the order of the pipeline. # this value will be used in the templated version of keystone-paste.ini # The last item in this pipeline must be admin_service or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter. default['openstack']['identity']['pipeline']['admin_api'] = 'healthcheck cors sizelimit http_proxy_to_wsgi url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension s3_extension admin_service' # This specify the pipeline of the keystone V3 API,

commit_message:
Autogenerate configuration documentation

This change aims to generate documentation for the configuration
options automatically. This requires a small fix to one of the
configuration option's help strings, which was incorrectly formatted as
a tuple.

Change-Id: I0878ef930b58e16b46cf437300b93e40ef4141d8
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
remove the global lower-constraints.txt file

Rely on our ability to compute a good lower constraints set for
multiple projects using the build-lower-constraints command instead of
maintaining a single list in this repository.

Change-Id: I0a4be42efdbfd73228d043c1aa21feb7829650f3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add --cleanup argument for image uploads

This exposes the new cleanup behavior from change
Id844aa2fa5ee20ad264b2fada75fa6cffdc1e307. When this lands it can be
used in CI to make undercloud deploys faster with --cleanup partial.

Change-Id: Id75d5288c308e58143662703da3dddbdbcb0cdd9
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

added_lines: --- features: - | The commands `openstack tripleo container image prepare` and `openstack overcloud container image upload` now have a --cleanup option to control what local images are removed after the image upload is complete.

commit_message:
Add subnet host_routes to output of OS::TripleO::*::Ports::Port

Adds the host_routes on the neutron ports subnet to the output
of the Tripleo Ports template. This will allow use of get_attr
in the role to pass routes for a subnet to NetworkConfig.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I46896153ea59ae0a6a8dff0208de2b0d168927ae

commit_message:
Parametrize ansible transport setting

As we want to share the ansible.cfg generation with
tripleo undercloud/standalone deployments, allow to
use custom transports, like local. Make
ansible ssh_private_key optional as no SSH keys might
be expected for some of the transport cases (like local).

Change-Id: Ie7dd9039ee74aac046679e831ffda143257e3825
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/57/580157/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssh_private_key=None, transport=None, if transport: config.set('defaults', 'transport', transport)

commit_message:
Fix connection plugin to work with Ansible 2.6.0

The connection plugin needs to follow the upstream connection/ssh
plugin's docstring, otherwise this causes failures for undefined options
sftp_executable and scp_executable. This PR adds those docstrings to
mirror upstream.

This follows on from a patch in upstream ansible:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36648/files

Change-Id: Ia2a2f2238bb60710c7efe76e2cd9f86493833a2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/28/580128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sftp_executable: default: sftp description: - This defines the location of the sftp binary. It defaults to `sftp` which will use the first binary available in $PATH. env: [{name: ANSIBLE_SFTP_EXECUTABLE}] ini: - {key: sftp_executable, section: ssh_connection} version_added: "2.6" scp_executable: default: scp description: - This defines the location of the scp binary. It defaults to `scp` which will use the first binary available in $PATH. env: [{name: ANSIBLE_SCP_EXECUTABLE}] ini: - {key: scp_executable, section: ssh_connection} version_added: "2.6"

commit_message:
Set configure_qemu to true to get qemu port range applied

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784 we change the default
migration port range to '61152-61215'.
nova::migration::qemu::configure_qemu needs to be set to true that
the config gets applied via puppet-nova.

Change-Id: Iad4b392c9fe7426f2ce10a02fadd8b1aeee34ef6
Closes-bug: 1779820
Depends-On: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32
(cherry picked from commit 547552fc7b6730f7d0670c5b0d76f63e5372f8c7)
(cherry picked from commit 322747fa6e62fd74bc6e40515b9563d8e62f4654)

subject: Add region_name for heat-config-notify
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-02 19:02:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-agents/commit/6836d84426f79254b1d54f61c6ae966c2647fe72', 'message': 'Add region_name for heat-config-notify

Now there is no region name when heat-config-notify try to get the
heat endpoint or zaqar endpoint. As a result, it could be a wrong
one returned from Keystone because there is no region name specified.
This patch fixes it.

Please refer Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 for the change
in Heat.

commit_message:
Add region_name for heat-config-notify

Now there is no region name when heat-config-notify try to get the
heat endpoint or zaqar endpoint. As a result, it could be a wrong
one returned from Keystone because there is no region name specified.
This patch fixes it.

Please refer Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 for the change
in Heat.

Please refer I88182a9a9af74e9760b2ec9b500971f06293f0b8 for the change
in occ.

Task: 22720
Story: 2002781

Change-Id: I8e0518fa61e237ec055834dd4bebe0fc87cd6627

commit_message:
Drop dmsetup from rootwrap

The 'dmsetup' command is not being used anywhere so remove it
from the volume.filters.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ie914d57bd39820d01ccdcf756f1fced4d1ca89b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/44/580944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deps = -r{toxinidir}/doc/requirements.txt commands = sphinx-build -a -E -W -d doc/build/doctrees -b html doc/source doc/build/html

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-02 10:55:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic/commit/52d46c03d38f81878a5b1953ffaea2b8eb79c137', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-07-02 13:09:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic/commit/c0fe8e9b6a288b575c5e288dc8e116db9c257ad4', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580601
Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/14/579514/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Ansible 2.5 is a hard dependency for this patch due to the dynamic setting
of the ansible_python_interpreter, which in 2.4 is literally interpreted,
but in 2.5 thanks to [1] is now templated. See [2] for more details.

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. As there are no required packages left, the task to install them is
also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Ansible 2.5 is a hard dependency for this patch due to the dynamic setting
of the ansible_python_interpreter, which in 2.4 is literally interpreted,
but in 2.5 thanks to [1] is now templated. See [2] for more details.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/33698
[2] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/18665

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: Ic3c0bb31c12a83fe8fe475091e97e5d5537fab6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/91/579991/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We set the python interpreter to the ansible runtime venv if # the delegation is to localhost so that we get access to the # appropriate python libraries in that venv. If the delegation # is to another host, we assume that it is accessible by the # system python instead. - name: Setup the default member role delegate_to: "{{ horizon_service_setup_host }}" vars: ansible_python_interpreter: >- {{ (horizon_service_setup_host == 'localhost') | ternary(ansible_playbook_python, ansible_python['executable']) }} block: - name: Add default member role os_keystone_role: cloud: default state: present name: "{{ horizon_default_role_name }}" endpoint_type: admin verify: "{{ not keystone_service_adminuri_insecure }}" register: add_service when: not heat_service_in_ldap | bool until: add_service is success retries: 5 delay: 10
deleted_lines: # Add the default user role - name: Ensure default keystone user role keystone: command: "ensure_role" endpoint: "{{ keystone_service_adminurl }}" login_user: "{{ keystone_admin_user_name }}" login_password: "{{ keystone_auth_admin_password }}" login_project_name: "{{ keystone_admin_tenant_name }}" role_name: "{{ horizon_default_role_name }}" insecure: "{{ keystone_service_adminuri_insecure }}" when: - keystone_admin_user_name is defined - keystone_auth_admin_password is defined - keystone_admin_tenant_name is defined - keystone_service_adminurl is defined - keystone_service_adminuri_insecure is defined register: add_member_role no_log: true until: add_member_role|success retries: 5 delay: 10

commit_message:
ODL feature fetch: parse configs

ODL supports a configuration string for each feature.
This string is now extracted from the json and made
available in the odl_features API.

Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I274f9ac337be5acd1f56d173fcd7584c82dd3b24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/21/564421/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: feature_configs = dict() global feature_configs feature_configs = None feature_configs = set(cfg.CONF.ml2_odl.odl_features) feature_configs = _fetch_features() if feature_configs is not None: return feature in feature_configs def get_config(feature): return feature_configs[feature] global feature_configs feature_configs = dict() response = dict() for feature in features['feature']: cfg = '' if 'configuration' in feature: cfg = feature['configuration'] response[feature['service-provider-feature'].split(':')[1]] = cfg
deleted_lines: feature_set = set() global feature_set feature_set = None feature_set = set(cfg.CONF.ml2_odl.odl_features) feature_set = _fetch_features() if feature_set is not None: return feature in feature_set global feature_set feature_set = set() response = set() for feature in features['feature']: response.add(feature['service-provider-feature'].split(':')[1])

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-02 18:35:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat/commit/9d5f43a3be040e251b9098a1f5e768024976f628', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: I261a49e374d34d00d0be1863da701b7a13ceb3c6

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: I261a49e374d34d00d0be1863da701b7a13ceb3c6

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-09 08:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/83d0a0d4d5620b969006b656140b8eb6f30c053f', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I308e9df65531f000b49ea22da2f5544047770108
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I308e9df65531f000b49ea22da2f5544047770108
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/64/580964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I06a45ffdb95e4c79edeca179254f25252d9fef6e

commit_message:
Running the node-exporter on all nodes.

Using a node selector can not run the node-exporter on the master node.
So, This PS changes the scheduling to use taint/toleration instead of
the node selector.

Change-Id: I54ee8c53b4ca3d4118953b811708a4eaab12fcdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/61/580961/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tolerations: - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master operator: Exists - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/node operator: Exists

subject: Sync service account keys for multi masters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-18 04:48:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/459edb8825dabb69b4016c9cebc2698df04880b2', 'message': 'Sync service account keys for multi masters

Multi master deployments for k8s driver use different service account
keys for each api/controller manager server which leads to 401 errors
for service accounts. This patch will create a new public/private keys
for k8s service account keys explicitly, dedicatedly for the k8s
cluster to avoid the inconsistent keys issue.

Task:  21653
Story: 1766546

Change-Id: I61547405f866d3c5a84da63de66724b55af1066a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-18 23:53:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/ee1ed61c56399437f0544e3c3684fdf82d38232d', 'message': 'Sync service account keys for multi masters

Multi master deployments for k8s driver use different service account
keys for each api/controller manager server which leads to 401 errors
for service accounts. This patch will create a new public/private keys
for k8s service account keys explicitly, dedicatedly for the k8s
cluster to avoid the inconsistent keys issue.

Task:  21653

commit_message:
Sync service account keys for multi masters

Multi master deployments for k8s driver use different service account
keys for each api/controller manager server which leads to 401 errors
for service accounts. This patch will create a signed cert and private
key for k8s service account keys explicitly, dedicatedly for the k8s
cluster to avoid the inconsistent keys issue.

Task:  21653
Story: 1766546

Change-Id: I61547405f866d3c5a84da63de66724b55af1066a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/29/576029/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kube_service_account_key: type: string description: > The public key will be used to verify the k8s service account tokens during authentication. kube_service_account_private_key: type: string description: > The private key will be used to sign generated k8s service account tokens. "$KUBE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY": {get_param: kube_service_account_key} "$KUBE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_PRIVATE_KEY": {get_param: kube_service_account_private_key}

subject: Increase vault init token use limit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-04 08:56:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide/commit/68873cdf30638f48f166d430734261f0051c3ee6', 'message': 'Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. At the moment it is set too low as the charm tries to use it
multiple times. This update increases the limit to allow the action
to complete.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-07-09 08:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['deploy-guide/source/app-vault.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide/commit/d78a90b3aef95a7a7a15bcff614bee523cdbed29', 'message': 'Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. The charm action uses the token multiple times so the action
fails. Since the token is created with a relatively short ttl it
seems reasonable to remove the usage limit entirely.

Feedback from users has shown that when following the documentation
the need to unseal each vault unit individually was missed so this
instruction is now next to the unseal explanation as well as being
reiterated in the HA section.

When deploying an HA configuration etcd must support etcd3, this
requirement was lacking in the instructions so it has been added.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875
'}]
commit_message:
Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. The charm action uses the token multiple times so the action
fails. Since the token is created with a relatively short ttl it
seems reasonable to remove the usage limit entirely.

Feedback from users has shown that when following the documentation
the need to unseal each vault unit individually was missed so this
instruction is now next to the unseal explanation as well as being
reiterated in the HA section.

When deploying an HA configuration etcd must support etcd3, this
requirement was lacking in the instructions so it has been added.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide refs/changes/96/580096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vault token create -use-limit=4 -ttl=10m

commit_message:
Fix bootstrap_host_exec check for manila_share

The hiera check for bootstrap node was using 'manila-share'
for service name, which returns nil.  Changing the service
name to 'manila_share', the hiera lookup for
'manila_share_short_bootstrap_node_name' succeeds.

Change-Id: Id3c001f8f0ee9dc156f22a027f66516d6812f51a
(cherry picked from commit 25f93efd8c3ce7335651b26818e30e5b6546cb42)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/580879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - 'manila_share'

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/5c157edc88d9c05b359e65312afc29ce0acae27b', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id03d28442b998624153e048ad9a621f31dbdb7d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id03d28442b998624153e048ad9a621f31dbdb7d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/40/573340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Ensure remote_user and become are consistently implemented

It makes no sense to use become when you're connecting to a
host via the root remote_user. As such, we remove all uses of
'become: true' from the test plays with the exception of the
'test-prepare-keys.yml' playbook which uses a local connection
rather than a remote one and it therefore needs to use become.

We also transition all plays to use 'remote_user' which is the
correct parameter to replace 'user' (since ansible 1.4).

Finally, we switch the horizon nova service setup to its own
playbook using a local connection and the upstream keystone
modules.

Change-Id: I20517c22f07b1bb811a51d8c63741604360fe7f8

subject: Fix unbound local when saving an unchanged RequestSpec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-05 07:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a31ebd87ba9a9c0ab0013fe59b6d5056c1193f4c', 'message': 'Fix unbound local when saving an unchanged RequestSpec

RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() tried to return the unitialized
db_updates field when the object has no changes. This patch initalizes
that local to None and handles that None in create() and save() where
the RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() is called.

Change-Id: Iad256079945bf8b5745ebdcc393c55115dbcab75
Closes-Bug: #1775863
(cherry picked from commit 08fb09e878dcaedbb446e18502a6172fa4d43121)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unbound local when saving an unchanged RequestSpec

RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() tried to return the unitialized
db_updates field when the object has no changes. This patch initalizes
that local to None and handles that None in create() and save() where
the RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() is called.

Change-Id: Iad256079945bf8b5745ebdcc393c55115dbcab75
Closes-Bug: #1775863
(cherry picked from commit 08fb09e878dcaedbb446e18502a6172fa4d43121)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/580309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_raises_on_unchanged_object(self): ctxt = context.RequestContext(uuids.user_id, uuids.project_id) req_obj = request_spec.RequestSpec(context=ctxt) self.assertRaises(exception.ObjectActionError, req_obj.create) def test_save_can_be_called_on_unchanged_object(self): req_obj = fake_request_spec.fake_spec_obj(remove_id=True) req_obj.create() req_obj.save()

commit_message:
Add Blazar support to Heat

Add OS::Blazar::Lease, OS::Blazar::Host and the relevant modules to
support Blazar which is a resource reservation services in OpenStack.
As a result of discussion with Blazar team, we dont't support stack
update for OS::Blazar::Host & OS::Blazar::Lease because the current host
and lease api scheme is not suitable for Heat's spec.  According to
Blazar's update in Rocky cycle, Heat will support the update stack
scenarios for Blazar.

Change-Id: I1392919540a6bdd67ce7078e3a1206ecdb9854e1
Implements: blueprint heat-plugin-blazar
Task: 19754
Story: 2002085

commit_message:
Add a Blazar Lease resource

Add a OS::Blazar::Lease resource plugin to support Blazar which is a
resource reservation services in OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ie4929c27f3b84bc70a3823aa87bdbec826d9eee5
Task: 22882
Story: 2002085

added_lines: def _action_columns(action): return action._info.keys() class ActionList(command.Lister): """List actions on a container""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".ListActions") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ActionList, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'container', metavar='<container>', help='ID or name of the container to list networks.' ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = _get_client(self, parsed_args) container = parsed_args.container actions = client.actions.list(container) columns = ('user_id', 'container_uuid', 'request_id', 'action', 'message', 'start_time') for action in actions: for out in action.containerActions: setattr(action, 'user_id', out['user_id']) setattr(action, 'container_uuid', out['container_uuid']) setattr(action, 'request_id', out['request_id']) setattr(action, 'action', out['action']) setattr(action, 'message', out['message']) setattr(action, 'start_time', out['start_time']) return (columns, (utils.get_item_properties(action, columns))) class ActionShow(command.ShowOne): """Show a action""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".ShowAction") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ActionShow, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'container', metavar='<container>', help='ID or name of the container to show.') parser.add_argument( '--request_id', metavar='<action>', default=False, help='UUID of action to describe.') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = _get_client(self, parsed_args) container = parsed_args.container request_id = parsed_args.request_id action = client.actions.get(container, request_id) columns = _action_columns(action) return columns, utils.get_item_properties(action, columns)

Separate kubelet support packages

Debian has no libxtables11 package
Libxtables11 only for ubuntu while libxtables12 for debian

commit_message:
PXE Filter dnsmasq: manage macs not in ironic

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it keeps
macs that are no longer in ironic blacklisted unless
introspection is active or node_not_found_hook is set.

Replacing the previous behaviour that would
exclusively whitelist macs that are no longer in
ironic.

Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/57/566757/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes the behavisour of the ``dnsmask`` PXE filter to clear the filter for ports not longer in ironic instead of whitelisting them. Related `bug #2001979 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001979>_`.

commit_message:
Point nrpe helper at nrpe files

The glance charm has a slightly different layout compared to other
OpenStack charms so nrpe.copy_nrpe_checks() needs to be pointed
at an alternative location for the nrpe checks the charm provides.

Change-Id: I3c7ce63069379008754bcba9201a3fc9c568853d
Closes-Bug: #1779155
(cherry picked from commit 4f935e39009e145210f7b5f53b0541fc7b02b7ac)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/99/579099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: charm_dir, nrpe_files_dir = os.path.join( charm_dir(), 'charmhelpers', 'contrib', 'openstack', 'files') nrpe.copy_nrpe_checks(nrpe_files_dir=nrpe_files_dir)

commit_message:
Change invalid input error code to 400

Now blazar instance plugin supports only ``affinity = False`` option.
This is because we have no scheme to check if the resource capability
is exceeded when mutiple instances land on the same compute host.

Currently we raise ``500`` (internal server) error when
``affinity = True`` is set by users. However, this error should be
``400`` (bad request error) to explicitly inform users that we don't
support it so far.

This patch fixes it to return ``400`` error using the
MalformedParameter() exception. A releasenote for this fix will be
added in a following patch.

Change-Id: Iea98a4d7c448470148b58982281b5d1e9f1892b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/71/575271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise mgr_exceptions.InvalidAffinity() raise mgr_exceptions.InvalidAffinity()
deleted_lines: raise exceptions.BlazarException('affinity = True is not ' 'supported.') raise exceptions.BlazarException('affinity = True is not ' 'supported.')

commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: I920451a103e4c2f8384a697fb79a4ab8333f6a3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/08/580908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron==13.0.0.0b1
