commit_message:
Generate the hosts inventory for OVN migration based on roles

Prior to this patch, we were relying on overcloud node names to decide
where to run ovn-controller and ovn-dbs. This is a bad idea as names
can be anything.

With TripleO composable roles, the safest option would be to run
ovn-dbs everywhere where neutron_api was running in ML2/OVS and run
ovn-controller where OVS agent was. This patch is figuring that out
through tripleo-ansible-inventory output.

Change-Id: Ic053f5a1ae152d564bf9f0f052ee8c80de786313
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/67/580167/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_role_hosts() { inventory_file=$1 role_name=$2 roles=`jq -r \.$role_name\.children\[\] $inventory_file` for role in $roles; do hosts=`jq -r --arg role "$role" 'to_entries[] | select(.key == $role) | .value.children[]' $inventory_file` for host in $hosts; do HOSTS="$HOSTS `jq -r --arg host "$host" 'to_entries[] | select(.key == $host) | .value.hosts[0]' $inventory_file`" done done echo $HOSTS } # We want to run ovn_dbs where neutron_api was running OVN_DBS=$(_get_role_hosts /tmp/ansible-inventory.txt neutron_api) for node_ip in $OVN_DBS # We want to run ovn-controller where OVS agent was running before the migration OVN_CONTROLLERS=$(_get_role_hosts /tmp/ansible-inventory.txt ovs_agent) for node_ip in $OVN_CONTROLLERS rm -f /tmp/ansible-inventory.txt
deleted_lines: CONTROLLERS=`openstack server list -c Name -c Networks | grep controller | awk '{ split($4, net, "="); print net[2] }'` for node_ip in $CONTROLLERS for node_ip in $CONTROLLERS for node_ip in `openstack server list -c Name -c Networks | grep compute | awk '{ split($4, net, "="); print net[2] }'` do echo $node_ip ansible_ssh_user=heat-admin ansible_become=true >> hosts_for_migration done

commit_message:
Use duration of all workers for aggregate object_replication_time

Instead of reporting the fastest worker completion time as the
aggregate completion time in recon data, report the time elapsed
between the first worker start time and the final worker end time. This
makes the object_replication_time consistent with
object_reconstruction_time.

Change-Id: I1eb064cf300170b7f9a6554c6ec792cf5918bb95

added_lines: class TestMinMaxTracker(unittest.TestCase): def test_tracker_empty(self): def do_test(): self.assertFalse(tracker.bounds) with self.assertRaises(IndexError): tracker.min with self.assertRaises(IndexError): tracker.max tracker = utils.MinMaxTracker() do_test() tracker.update() do_test() def test_tracker(self): def do_test(update, expected): tracker.update(*update) self.assertEqual(list(expected), tracker.bounds) self.assertIs(expected[0], tracker.min) self.assertIs(expected[1], tracker.max) tracker = utils.MinMaxTracker() do_test((0,), (0, 0)) do_test((0.0, 0), (0, 0)) do_test((0.0, 0.0), (0, 0)) # NB current max value trumps equal update do_test((0, 10.0), (0, 10.0)) do_test((-5.1, 10.0), (-5.1, 10.0)) do_test((-10.0, 5.0), (-10.0, 10.0)) do_test((-5.0, 20), (-10.0, 20)) do_test((-11.0, -20.0), (-20.0, 20)) do_test((-5, -20, -30.0, 10, 40.0), (-30.0, 40.0)) do_test((100.0,), (-30.0, 100.0)) do_test((), (-30.0, 100.0)) # types can be mixed do_test(('a', 'z'), (-30.0, 'z')) do_test((None, None), (None, 'z'))

commit_message:
Remove release-tools from Release Management

The Release Management Team has retired the
openstack-infra/release-tools repository, so it should no longer be
tracked as an official deliverable. Move it to the legacy
deliverables list.

Change-Id: Idd17c32bdc851d60d0c9b3815880d07b465418eb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579185

commit_message:
make python3-first job commands look at template definitions

Look at the jobs inside the template definitions, if available, to
determine where branches might be specified.

Change-Id: I7eec82499887bddc63a1ad12f3d1f31b1d4d1083
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/goal-tools refs/changes/72/579672/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Items we know we need to keep in project-config. KEEP = set([ 'translation-jobs-queens', 'periodic-jobs-with-oslo-master', 'api-ref-jobs', 'release-openstack-server', 'publish-to-pypi', 'publish-to-pypi-quietly', 'publish-to-pypi-horizon', 'publish-to-pypi-neutron', ])def find_templates_only_on_master(project, zuul_templates, zuul_jobs): needs_to_stay = set() for template_name in templates: if template_name in needs_to_stay: continue LOG.debug('looking at template %r', template_name) jobs_only_on_master = set() try: template_settings = zuul_templates[template_name] except KeyError: LOG.debug('did not find template definition for %r', template_name) continue for queue_name in template_settings.keys(): queue = template_settings[queue_name] if not isinstance(queue, dict): continue for job in queue.get('jobs', []): if isinstance(job, str): job_name = job try: job_params = zuul_jobs[job_name] except KeyError: LOG.debug('could not find job definition for %r', job_name) continue else: job_name = list(job.keys())[0] job_params = list(job.values())[0] LOG.debug('looking at job %s', job_name) branches = list(branches_for_job(job_params)) LOG.debug('branches: %r', branches) if branches == ['master']: LOG.debug('ONLY ON MASTER') jobs_only_on_master.add(job_name) if jobs_only_on_master: needs_to_stay.add(template_name) return needs_to_stay def find_templates_to_extract(project, zuul_templates, zuul_jobs): templates = project.get('templates', []) # Initialize the set of templates we need to keep in # project-config with some things we know about, then add any with # jobs only on the master branch. needs_to_stay = KEEP.union(find_templates_only_on_master( project, zuul_templates, zuul_jobs)) if t not in needs_to_stay '--openstack-zuul-jobs-dir', default='../openstack-zuul-jobs', help='the location of the openstack-zuul-jobs repo', ) parser.add_argument( zuul_templates_filename = os.path.join( parsed_args.openstack_zuul_jobs_dir, 'zuul.d', 'project-templates.yaml', ) LOG.debug('loading project templates from %s', zuul_templates_filename) with open(zuul_templates_filename, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: zuul_templates_raw = yaml.load(f) zuul_templates = { pt['project-template']['name']: pt['project-template'] for pt in zuul_templates_raw if 'project-template' in pt } zuul_jobs_filename = os.path.join( parsed_args.openstack_zuul_jobs_dir, 'zuul.d', 'jobs.yaml', ) LOG.debug('loading jobs from %s', zuul_jobs_filename) with open(zuul_jobs_filename, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: zuul_jobs_raw = yaml.load(f) zuul_jobs = { job['job']['name']: job['job'] for job in zuul_jobs_raw if 'job' in job } find_templates_to_extract(entry['project'], zuul_templates, zuul_jobs)def find_templates_to_retain(project, zuul_templates, zuul_jobs): # Initialize the set of templates we need to keep in # project-config with some things we know about, then add any with # jobs only on the master branch. needs_to_stay = KEEP.union(find_templates_only_on_master( project, zuul_templates, zuul_jobs)) if t in needs_to_stay if 'system-required' not in to_keep: to_keep.insert(0, 'system-required') project['templates'] = to_keep '--openstack-zuul-jobs-dir', default='../openstack-zuul-jobs', help='the location of the openstack-zuul-jobs repo', ) parser.add_argument( zuul_templates_filename = os.path.join( parsed_args.openstack_zuul_jobs_dir, 'zuul.d', 'project-templates.yaml', ) LOG.debug('loading project templates from %s', zuul_templates_filename) with open(zuul_templates_filename, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: zuul_templates_raw = yaml.load(f) zuul_templates = { pt['project-template']['name']: pt['project-template'] for pt in zuul_templates_raw if 'project-template' in pt } zuul_jobs_filename = os.path.join( parsed_args.openstack_zuul_jobs_dir, 'zuul.d', 'jobs.yaml', ) LOG.debug('loading jobs from %s', zuul_jobs_filename) with open(zuul_jobs_filename, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: zuul_jobs_raw = yaml.load(f) zuul_jobs = { job['job']['name']: job['job'] for job in zuul_jobs_raw if 'job' in job } find_templates_to_retain(entry['project'], zuul_templates, zuul_jobs)
deleted_lines: # Items to keep in project-config. KEEP = []def find_templates_to_extract(project): if t not in KEEP find_templates_to_extract(entry['project'])def find_templates_to_retain(project): # Remove the items that need to move to the project repo. if t in KEEP if to_keep: project['templates'] = to_keep elif 'templates' in project: del project['templates'] find_templates_to_retain(entry['project'])

commit_message:
Glance: Update management jobs to fail on incorrect config

This PS updates the glance management jobs to fail on incorrect
configuration, or abnormal interaction between components.

Change-Id: I87eb8f28bfaa93467f2690d8a7f92b062f9d257f
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Make obj replicator config error messages more informative

If a bad value is supplied for replicator worker options
then have the ValueError message report the option name.

Also, do not confusingly report that the bad value is '0'
when in fact no value has been set.

Related-Change: Iad468610b66b1bce82ab23f158a6f20e97025216

Change-Id: I2eb18a22486ab04263c97e5440f939dd7a3005dd

commit_message:
use db utils from lib

The APIs our consumers are using from neutron.db_utils were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540161/

This patch consumes them by removing the rehomed APIs and using lib's
implementation where applicable.

commit_message:
Set configure_qemu to true to get qemu port range applied

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784 we change the default
migration port range to '61152-61215'.
nova::migration::qemu::configure_qemu needs to be set to true that
the config gets applied via puppet-nova.

Change-Id: Iad4b392c9fe7426f2ce10a02fadd8b1aeee34ef6
Closes-bug: 1779820
Depends-On: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32

commit_message:
Add --roles to update run CLI command.

To provide a consistent upgrades/updates CLI,
the same --roles and --nodes argument is added into
minor updates  CLI command. The use of these two
arguments is mutually exclusive, either we specify a
set of nodes or controlplane roles in which the minor
update will be run.

Change-Id: I1971b19b28049c98697631d6b0e190bdda078fcb

commit_message:
Prevent taskflow creation in impossible import

This change prevents taskflow creation during image import in cases
we know for sure that the image activation won't be successful.

The change follows the Glance principles of failing early and tries
to provide as meaningful error messages to the end user as possible.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1758943
Change-Id: Iaee2781d07f4c0afd4f886f0b30b523bd47f1058
(cherry picked from commit 0376185fb34a8cba3d8d705e579e08cddfb9316d)

commit_message:
[Unity] Return logged-out initiators

In current implementation, Unity driver doesn't return the targets which
connect to the logged-out initiators, which causes the zone manager
fails to clean up the FC zone.

The fix returns all the targets of specified initiators no matter they
are logged in or not.

Change-Id: I1438d0bd4a43e1813dfb0a6e9b3c4a177c2fee8f
Closes-bug: #1773305
(cherry picked from commit 1ef06d4a31c3010f170da20fcc823dd81e77c1a7)
(cherry picked from commit e8c223f1f9041a2204138ea587a25728c4dba6fd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/580111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Dell EMC Unity Driver: Fixes `bug 1773305 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1773305>`__ to return the targets which connect to the logged-out initiators. Then the zone manager could clean up the FC zone based on the correct target wwns.

commit_message:
load neutron objects using neutron-lib

To access neutron objects we're moving to a dynamic plugin approach as
shown in the depends on and related patches.

This patch removes the imports of neutron.objects and uses neutron-lib
to load them instead. The remaining base object import will be addressed
later.

It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.14.0.

Change-Id: Ia4f0c969ef90df369232a7cd6e0dee6598c1d60b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570060/

subject: Ensure node is rebooted before enabling DPDK
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-05 03:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_network/host_config_and_reboot.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/69538522957ac6ce0e46af87624a0f172559c079', 'message': 'Ensure node is rebooted before enabling DPDK

In the PreNetworkConfig, the order of resources sent to os-collect-config
changed after introducing vhost user resource. The current order is
1. HostParametersDeployment
2. DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
3. RebootDeployment and EnableDpdkDeployment
Here the expectation is that RebootDeployment should be completed
before enabling DPDK, but since both are provided at the same time to
os-collect-config, DPDK is enabled first. The reson is RebootDepolyment
is having signal transport as NONE and EnableDpdkDeployment is moved
after reboot because of ovs2.7 change of restart vswitchd, when DPDK is
enabled. This is causing the a failure.
This patch modifies the order as below:
1. HostParametersDeployment and DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
2. RebootDeployment and RebootEnsureDeployment
3. EnableDpdkDeployment

Related-Bug: #1780014
Change-Id: I5db52d5dd833833c989532931baea8fac03f9cb7
(cherry picked from commit f9e099f218c4c5bcba5ae3daeabc7e15d75fe136)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure node is rebooted before enabling DPDK

In the PreNetworkConfig, the order of resources sent to os-collect-config
changed after introducing vhost user resource. The current order is
1. HostParametersDeployment
2. DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
3. RebootDeployment and EnableDpdkDeployment
Here the expectation is that RebootDeployment should be completed
before enabling DPDK, but since both are provided at the same time to
os-collect-config, DPDK is enabled first. The reson is RebootDepolyment
is having signal transport as NONE and EnableDpdkDeployment is moved
after reboot because of ovs2.7 change of restart vswitchd, when DPDK is
enabled. This is causing the a failure.
This patch modifies the order as below:
1. HostParametersDeployment and DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
2. RebootDeployment and RebootEnsureDeployment
3. EnableDpdkDeployment

Related-Bug: #1780014
Change-Id: I5db52d5dd833833c989532931baea8fac03f9cb7
(cherry picked from commit f9e099f218c4c5bcba5ae3daeabc7e15d75fe136)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/62/580262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: depends_on: [HostParametersDeployment, DpdkVhostGroupDeployment] # For successful RebootDeployment, the signal_transport should be NO_SIGNAL, # which will make the resource as COMPLETE immediately. If the # RebootDeployment is the last resource of the tree, then it will be # synchronized, else the next resource (EnableDpdkDeployment), is also sent # along with RebootDeployment. Because of which sometimes, EnableDpdkDeployment # is executed before rebooting. As hugepages are not set to bootargs (waiting # for reboot), EnableDpdkDeployment will fail. To ensure synchronization, # a dummpy deployment RebootEnsureDeployment has been introduced to wait # for reboot to enable DPDK. RebootEnsureConfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig condition: is_reboot_config_required properties: group: script config: | #!/bin/bash echo "Reboot completed" RebootEnsureDeployment: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment depends_on: RebootDeployment condition: is_reboot_config_required properties: name: RebootEnsureDeployment server: {get_param: server} config: {get_resource: RebootEnsureConfig} actions: if: - deployment_actions_empty - [] - ['CREATE'] # Only do this on CREATE depends_on: RebootEnsureDeployment
deleted_lines: depends_on: HostParametersDeployment depends_on: HostParametersDeployment depends_on: DpdkVhostGroupDeployment depends_on: DpdkVhostGroupDeployment depends_on: RebootDeployment depends_on: RebootDeployment

subject: Fix ordering of source/console installs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-06 10:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/59c7671c3e7c388786580c63e573b764ccaf88d2', 'message': "Fix ordering of source/console installs

When the console is set to 'novnc', the install process
will conditionally install pip packages into the venv
when in developer mode. To detect this is checks for
'nova_get_venv | failed or nova_get_venv | skipped' which
is only present if the source-install has been done first.

This patch fixes the ordering so that the installation of
the venv is done before the console install.

Change-Id: I3fc4bba4398d5aec605cb3ba19ae482c72f94bca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ordering of source/console installs

When the console is set to 'novnc', the install process
will conditionally install pip packages into the venv
when in developer mode. To detect this is checks for
'nova_get_venv | failed or nova_get_venv | skipped' which
is only present if the source-install has been done first.

This patch fixes the ordering so that the installation of
the venv is done before the console install.

Change-Id: I3fc4bba4398d5aec605cb3ba19ae482c72f94bca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/01/580601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - name: Install nova packages from PIP include_tasks: nova_install_source.yml when: nova_install_method == 'source'

commit_message:
Switch hive_enable_db_notification's default value

Make this change for CDH 5.13.0.

And do so, such that the user may...
* easily observe the new default value
* easily override the new default value

Change-Id: Ic2805ee0fb6bc2d96144e86b8a3f49beae3e1cef

commit_message:
RBD: support to get manageable snapshots

This patch adds the ability to get manageable snapshots to RBD driver.

Partial-Implements: blueprint ceph-list-manageable-volumes-and-snapshots
Change-Id: I2f979f445aeb2664c93c6810dcf2e82aed92a8cf

Sphinx version 1.7.5 is raised doc build failures. Maybe deps are not
suitable with current sphinx version.

This change removes the flag for treating warning-as-errors [1],
until we can get some of the changes upstream if possible.

This patch also fix functional test, due to neutron out of date version
and setns() of pynetns doesn't return any open FD anymore [2]. 

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/128986.html
[2] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/2e7964f498f97da83774eedeb868f785a2a6d107

commit_message:
[Gate] Avoid sphinx_build error and fix functional test

Sphinx version 1.7.5 is raised doc build failures. Maybe deps are not
suitable with current sphinx version.

This patch fixes functional test, due to neutron out of date
version and setns() of pynetns doesn't return any open FD anymore [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/128986.html
[2] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/2e7964f498f97da83774eedeb868f785a2a6d107

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I44c89a4637a6c6b10f374f83ff76fb1225b603b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/01/578001/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = sphinx-build -b html doc/source doc/build/html

subject: Change default age of purge_images_table to 180
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-06 12:11:20.000000000', 'files': ['glance/cmd/manage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/864d1ad714ba85c6866dd3746e4beb9c06d0c88f', 'message': 'Change default age of purge_images_table to 180

The `glance manage purge-images-table` is supposed to be used
only if really required due to OSSN-0075. And the advice is
not to purge any freshly deleted rows due to the possible
ID collision of still in use images. This change increases
the default of "age_in_days" to 180 from it's original 30 to
stress this out. User can still define smaller age if they
must.

Change-Id: Idb13288b72b31940a357fc9b11db2d6bcd396261
'}]
commit_message:
Change default age of purge_images_table to 180

The `glance manage purge-images-table` is supposed to be used
only if really required due to OSSN-0075. And the advice is
not to purge any freshly deleted rows due to the possible
ID collision of still in use images. This change increases
the default of "age_in_days" to 180 from it's original 30 to
stress this out. User can still define smaller age if they
must.

Change-Id: Idb13288b72b31940a357fc9b11db2d6bcd396261
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/15/580615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Run tempest tests with stable branch

Tempest plugins are branchless so we need to make sure the test
suite work with both master and stable branches. This patch adds
a job for running tempest test with stable branch. We choose to
use py35 because py27 jobs will be deprecated soon.

Depends-On: Iecb701498a565c784ada1c7f4a4649912abdf26f
Change-Id: Ib4ae1b1968c3d35af58d0d99479a9cfd75b7450d

commit_message:
Emphasize value of mailing lists

Add a paragraph explaining why the mailing lists are the single
best resource we have for communication.

Change-Id: Ia887c11381ee8aabbce11c22938610aed8be3557
Story: 2001710
Task: 22658
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/94/580694/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Because mailing lists are a form of asynchronous communication, they are the best resource the community has for sharing information with, and getting ideas from, the entire community. People who participate at different times of the day or less regularly have a greater opportunity to engage. People who read or write English with different levels of proficiency can be on a more (but not perfectly) level playing field with email than they might be with synchronous forms of text-based communication, such as IRC. When in doubt, prefer using a mailing list to other options.

commit_message:
Use openstack_version to determine Journalbeat hosts

Systemd journals are linked from the containers down to the hosts
starting in Rocky. Prior to this Journalbeat must also be on all
containers.

Change-Id: Iaaef19e76c40ba9c1ad58164c20da46766abeee6

commit_message:
Create a new parent layer for multinode jobs

Redefine nodeset for multinode and singlenode jobs.
The previous nodeset would waste nodepool resources for running
singlenode jobs.

Change-Id: Ieeaad2ba641d995f2583fc5ba4141ab26002dc2b
Closes-Bug: #1780324

commit_message:
Overhaul ironic role

Removed unused variables when able and updated to the new ironic driver
definitions found here.

https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-to-hardware-types.html

The intention is to support the drivers via profiles, so the table from
the above link was converted to a dictionary.  This dictionary was used
as a source when combining / concatenating the various drivers for each
profile into a usable list.  The standalone logic was simplified.

Change-Id: I19553af41b5e669386b855209c61235bf37371f2
Closes-Bug: 1758351
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
new_release: go back in history and compute depth

make get_last_release() go further back in release history,
compute the depth at which it finds a release.

Properly increment feature version based on the depth at
which the last release was found.

Change-Id: I5880611a7d9005cee8fe4c2d7920f84d880eeeb8
Task: 22351

commit_message:
Use openstack.config for config and Session objects

The TimingSession functionality has been merged into keystoneauth. This
allows us to use the CloudRegion object to get the Session directly.

Change-Id: Ib4c9210e681a2d2d9c5fc40de2c3ede1a5003154

subject: GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-13 00:02:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_goodness_weigher.py', 'cinder/scheduler/weights/goodness.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a02126af7933ae4d5356bc6fa2e3422854ba2838', 'message': 'GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
'}]
commit_message:
GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/22/574922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: qos_specs = weight_properties.get('qos_specs', {}) or {} volume_type = weight_properties.get('volume_type', {}) or {} request_spec = weight_properties.get('request_spec', {}) or {}

commit_message:
Remove release-tools configuration

Remove configuration specific to the now-retired
openstack-infra/release-tools repository and set its Gerrit ACL to
the common read-only one shared by all retired projects. In removing
the ACL, switch the ACL used by the release-test repository as it
shared this one previously.

Change-Id: Ib03e48b1771bd43502abf28f866b13a636506585
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579188

commit_message:
Make primary only and handoff only workers dump separate recon stats

...currently they overwrite each others stats so there is only
ever a partial set of stats in the recon file.

Related-Change: Iad468610b66b1bce82ab23f158a6f20e97025216
Change-Id: I4396baeb1f21fe23a8177a9a84a54ba1541ba276

now repeat using workers in handoff_only and primary_only modes start = the_time[0] with mock.patch.object(self.replicator, 'replicate', self.fake_replicate), \ mock.patch('time.time', mock_time): self.replicator.get_worker_args() self.replicator.run_once( multiprocess_worker_index=0, override_devices=['sda', 'sdb', 'sdc'], replicator_mode=object_replicator.MODE_PRIMARIES_ONLY) self.replicator.run_once( multiprocess_worker_index=1, override_devices=['sda', 'sdb'], replicator_mode=object_replicator.MODE_HANDOFFS_ONLY) self.replicator.run_once( multiprocess_worker_index=0, override_devices=['sdd', 'sde'], replicator_mode=object_replicator.MODE_PRIMARIES_ONLY) self.replicator.run_once( multiprocess_worker_index=1, override_devices=['sdc', 'sdd', 'sde'], replicator_mode=object_replicator.MODE_HANDOFFS_ONLY) self.replicator.post_multiprocess_run() with open(self.recon_file) as fh: recon_data = json.load(fh) all_partitions = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk'] self.assertEqual({}, all_partitions) # stale data cleaned up for section in ('object_replication_per_disk_primaries_only', 'object_replication_per_disk_handoffs_only'): self.assertIn(section, recon_data) part_recon_data = recon_data[section] for dev in ('sda', 'sdb', 'sdc', 'sdd', 'sde'): with annotate_failure('section %s dev %s' % (section, dev)): self.assertIn(dev, part_recon_data) sda = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk_primaries_only']['sda'] self.assertEqual(sda['replication_stats']['attempted'], 1) self.assertEqual(sda['replication_stats']['success'], 10) self.assertEqual(sda['object_replication_time'], 2) # minutes self.assertEqual(sda['object_replication_last'], start + 120) sda = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk_handoffs_only']['sda'] self.assertEqual(sda['replication_stats']['attempted'], 1) self.assertEqual(sda['replication_stats']['success'], 10) self.assertEqual(sda['object_replication_time'], 2) # minutes self.assertEqual(sda['object_replication_last'], start + 360) # Aggregate the workers' recon updates self.replicator.post_multiprocess_run() with open(self.recon_file) as fh: recon_data = json.load(fh) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['attempted'], 30) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['failure'], 3000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['hashmatch'], 30000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['remove'], 3000000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['rsync'], 300000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['success'], 300) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['suffix_count'], 30000000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['suffix_hash'], 300000000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['suffix_sync'], 3000000000) self.assertEqual(recon_data['replication_stats']['failure_nodes'], { '10.1.1.1': {'d11': 2}, '10.2.2.2': {'d22': 4}, '10.3.3.3': {'d33': 6}, '10.4.4.4': {'d44': 8}, '10.5.5.5': {'d55': 10}, }) self.assertEqual(recon_data['object_replication_time'], 2) # minutes self.assertEqual(recon_data['object_replication_last'], start + 120) # Run again in all_partitions mode with mock.patch.object(self.replicator, 'replicate', self.fake_replicate), \ mock.patch('time.time', mock_time): self.replicator.get_worker_args() self.replicator.run_once( multiprocess_worker_index=0, override_devices=['sda', 'sdb', 'sdc', 'sdd', 'sde'], replicator_mode=object_replicator.MODE_ALL_PARTITIONS) with open(self.recon_file) as fh: recon_data = json.load(fh) # historic primary only and handoff only data cleaned up primary_only = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk_primaries_only'] self.assertEqual({}, primary_only) handoff_only = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk_handoffs_only'] self.assertEqual({}, handoff_only) all_partitions = recon_data['object_replication_per_disk'] for dev in ('sda', 'sdb', 'sdc', 'sdd', 'sde'): with annotate_failure('dev %s' % dev): self.assertIn(dev, all_partitions)

commit_message:
proposal: OSA: Do not sync tests/tests-repo-clone.sh anymore

The tests/tests-repo-clone.sh file is being phased out from the OSA
repositories so the proposal bot should not sync that anymore.

Change-Id: Ia923fe60a80110ea09a350670c54a4011a13b089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/76/557176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: declare -ra files_to_remove=(tests/tests-repo-clone.sh)needs_removal() { for r in ${files_to_remove[@]}; do [[ $r == $1 ]] && return 0 done return 1 } if needs_removal ${x}; then rm ${OSA_PROJECT}/${x} else cp ${x} ${OSA_PROJECT}/${x} fi

commit_message:
tempest: mark test_port_association_many_bgpvpn_routes unstable

Until the test becomes reliable, marking it as "unstable" with this
annotation will prevent its failure from resulting in a failed tempest
job (this single test will be marked as "skipped").

Change-Id: Ib083ff266759c180912e5cfa865b8784bca6de9d
Related-Bug: 1780205
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/16/580316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.tests import base as test_base @test_base.unstable_test("bug 1780205") "ping server 2 alternative ip %s" % ip) LOG.debug("Check that server 1 can't " "ping server 2 alternative ip %s" % ip)
deleted_lines: + "ping server 2 alternative ip " + ip) LOG.debug("Check that server 1 cannot " + "ping server 2 alternative ip")

commit_message:
Let scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates run on queens

scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates will run on Queens, and
we'll configure projects to make it non voting on this branch.

Change-Id: If894e94d1038470cf060c38b0aca643eafa52c74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/95/569195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: branches: ^(?!stable/(newton|ocata|pike)).*$

commit_message:
(queens) add container minimal check

fs037 scenario000 update job is gating
most of tripleo but not yet checking
or gating openstack/tripleo-upgrade

Note: this is a modified backport, as we make the job non voting
for now in Queens.

Note: Please merge this review prior to workflowing
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569195/1/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I84c44a4f3cbc7ff0b54b1f04746e285a0a2d575c
(cherry picked from commit 70cc10edc159b2a6bd351a0fa65ce330ab93ac45)

subject: CI: move CentOS image preparation into pre-run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-06 09:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'playbooks/integration/run.yaml', 'playbooks/integration/centos-image.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith/commit/864459e21910d849fa471afbcc1fbb593b0c1ed7', 'message': 'CI: move CentOS image preparation into pre-run

Change-Id: I1243ad5c0cafd722d40d17e95cb7174ff3bafdf1
'}]
commit_message:
CI: move CentOS image preparation into pre-run

Change-Id: I1243ad5c0cafd722d40d17e95cb7174ff3bafdf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/88/580588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all environment: OS_CLOUD: devstack-admin tasks: - name: Install guestfish package: name: libguestfs-tools state: present become: true - name: Make kernel files readable (workaround for Ubuntu) shell: chmod 0644 /boot/vmlinuz-* become: true - name: Download the CentOS image get_url: url: "{{ centos_image_url }}" dest: "{{ centos_image_file }}.xz" register: centos_image_result until: centos_image_result | succeeded retries: 3 delay: 10 - name: Unpack the CentOS image command: xz -d {{ centos_image_file }}.xz - name: Print filesystems from the image command: virt-filesystems -a {{ centos_image_file }} -l --extra --block-devices - name: Create a temporary directory for extraction tempfile: state: directory suffix: boot register: temp_dir - name: Extract kernel/ramdisk from the image command: > virt-get-kernel -a {{ centos_image_file }} -o {{ temp_dir.path }} --unversioned-names environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Copy the kernel and ramdisk to the target directory copy: src: "{{ temp_dir.path }}/{{ item.src }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" remote_src: yes with_items: - src: vmlinuz dest: "{{ centos_kernel_file }}" - src: initramfs dest: "{{ centos_initramfs_file }}" - name: Extract the root file system command: virt-tar-out -a {{ centos_image_file }} / {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Extract /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config command: > tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar -C {{ temp_dir.path }} --extract {{ item }} with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Remove /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config from the archive command: tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar --delete {{ item }} with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Edit /etc/fstab to replace UUID with LABEL command: sed -i 's/UUID=[^ ]* /\/dev\/vda2 /' {{ temp_dir.path}}/etc/fstab - name: Rewrite /etc/selinux/config to disable selinux copy: dest: "{{ temp_dir.path }}/etc/selinux/config" content: "SELINUX=disabled" - name: Add edited /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config back command: > tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar -C {{ temp_dir.path }} --append {{ item }} --owner root --group root with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Pack the root file system into a partition image command: virt-make-fs {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar {{ centos_partition_file }} environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Print filesystems from the image command: virt-filesystems -a {{ centos_partition_file }} -l --extra --block-devices - name: Remove the temporary directory file: state: absent path: "{{ temp_dir.path }}" - name: Upload the CentOS whole-disk image command: > openstack image create --disk-format qcow2 --public --file {{ centos_image_file }} {{ centos_glance_whole_disk_image }} when: centos_glance_whole_disk_image is defined - name: Upload the CentOS kernel image command: > openstack image create --disk-format aki --container-format aki \ --public --file {{ centos_kernel_file }} -f value -c id {{ centos_glance_kernel_image }} register: centos_kernel_id failed_when: centos_kernel_id.stdout == "" when: centos_glance_kernel_image is defined - name: Upload the CentOS initramfs image command: > openstack image create --disk-format ari --container-format ari \ --public --file {{ centos_initramfs_file }} -f value -c id {{ centos_glance_initramds_image }} register: centos_initramfs_id failed_when: centos_initramfs_id.stdout == "" when: centos_glance_initramds_image is defined - name: Upload the CentOS partition image command: > openstack image create --disk-format qcow2 --public --file {{ centos_partition_file }} --property kernel_id={{ centos_kernel_id.stdout }} --property ramdisk_id={{ centos_initramfs_id.stdout }} {{ centos_glance_root_image }} when: centos_glance_root_image is defined
deleted_lines: - name: Install guestfish package: name: libguestfs-tools state: present become: true - name: Make kernel files readable (workaround for Ubuntu) shell: chmod 0644 /boot/vmlinuz-* become: true - name: Set CentOS image name set_fact: centos_image_name: CentOS-7-x86_64-GenericCloud - name: Set CentOS image facts set_fact: centos_image_url: https://cloud.centos.org/centos/7/images/{{ centos_image_name }}.qcow2.xz centos_image_file: ~/{{ centos_image_name }}.qcow2 centos_kernel_file: ~/{{ centos_image_name }}.kernel centos_initramfs_file: ~/{{ centos_image_name }}.initramfs centos_partition_file: ~/{{ centos_image_name }}-root.qcow2 - name: Download the CentOS image get_url: url: "{{ centos_image_url }}" dest: "{{ centos_image_file }}.xz" register: centos_image_result until: centos_image_result | succeeded retries: 3 delay: 10 - name: Unpack the CentOS image command: xz -d {{ centos_image_file }}.xz - name: Print filesystems from the image command: virt-filesystems -a {{ centos_image_file }} -l --extra --block-devices - name: Create a temporary directory for extraction tempfile: state: directory suffix: boot register: temp_dir - name: Extract kernel/ramdisk from the image command: > virt-get-kernel -a {{ centos_image_file }} -o {{ temp_dir.path }} --unversioned-names environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Copy the kernel and ramdisk to the target directory copy: src: "{{ temp_dir.path }}/{{ item.src }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" remote_src: yes with_items: - src: vmlinuz dest: "{{ centos_kernel_file }}" - src: initramfs dest: "{{ centos_initramfs_file }}" - name: Extract the root file system command: virt-tar-out -a {{ centos_image_file }} / {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Extract /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config command: > tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar -C {{ temp_dir.path }} --extract {{ item }} with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Remove /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config from the archive command: tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar --delete {{ item }} with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Edit /etc/fstab to replace UUID with LABEL command: sed -i 's/UUID=[^ ]* /\/dev\/vda2 /' {{ temp_dir.path}}/etc/fstab - name: Rewrite /etc/selinux/config to disable selinux copy: dest: "{{ temp_dir.path }}/etc/selinux/config" content: "SELINUX=disabled" - name: Add edited /etc/fstab and /etc/selinux/config back command: > tar -f {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar -C {{ temp_dir.path }} --append {{ item }} --owner root --group root with_items: - ./etc/fstab - ./etc/selinux/config - name: Pack the root file system into a partition image command: virt-make-fs {{ temp_dir.path }}/root.tar {{ centos_partition_file }} environment: LIBGUESTFS_DEBUG: 1 - name: Print filesystems from the image command: virt-filesystems -a {{ centos_partition_file }} -l --extra --block-devices - name: Remove the temporary directory file: state: absent path: "{{ temp_dir.path }}"

subject: Add run time graph for jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-25 21:18:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/db56e1649dde07e3f61b2601a689f489a02ff9ac', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.

New behavior:
  A linear chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided
  by the timedelta given by the user in the Resolution drop down.
  As a result, only a linear run time line was drawn because scatter
  points didn't seem feasible without having to include the run_time
  property into the api._aggregate_runs method[1], which would result in
  a much larger payload and a large number of scatter points that I don't
  think would be readable. I didn't test this, but just my thoughts on
  that part.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/26f188a1021d07e9afa532e7053a8bfd242947c9/openstack_health/api.py#L345

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-25 23:37:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/dd133a01bec918621f63923a0aad391df8174ac7', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  An array property called 'run_times' was added to this response
  in order to support drawing the scatter chart on the canvas.
  Since there are no unqiue datetimes supplied with these run_times
  the same datetime of the timedelta object was used.

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560

commit_message:
Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  The original response of this API call is wrapped in a 'data' property
  and the additional information to support drawing the scatter chart on
  the canvas is added to a new dict property called 'numeric'.

NOTE:
  * The methods in run_aggregator were derived from [1] and [2]
  * An experiment was done to see which implementation would
    result in the lowest load time and the results for the job
    'tempest-full' for 2 weeks and 1 month periods are as follows:
    - latest patch with 1 db call
        2.21s - 2 weeks
        3.40s - 1 month

    - older patch with 2 db calls
        7.86s - 2 weeks
        10.16s - 1 month

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370913/4
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/4db9a614711a2e52f9c827a9340e7ff7d1882751/openstack_health/test_run_aggregator.py#L70-L90
Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary py27 testenv

The pyNN factors automatically set basepython unless explicitly requested otherwise.
Therefore, "testenv:py27" section are unnecessary and should be removed
as the recommendation from Stephen in [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580250/3/tox.ini@15

Change-Id: I07428041f70c68520c451589fc65cb586741b69b

commit_message:
Retry floating IP tests

test_server_attach_detach_floating_ip() has a test for server
add/remove floating IP that seems to be racy, add a retry loop
to let neutron and nova do their thing before calling it bad.

Change-Id: I999a0d7dae1706d746053bafb7ab4e3b791d0042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/61/578961/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time # Loop a few times since this is timing-sensitive # Just hard-code it for now, since there is no pause and it is # racy we shouldn't have to wait too long, a minute seems reasonable wait_time = 0 while wait_time < 60: cmd_output = json.loads(self.openstack( 'server show -f json ' + name )) if cmd_output['addresses'] != floating_ip: # Hang out for a bit and try again print('retrying floating IP check') wait_time += 10 time.sleep(10) else: break

commit_message:
Add to_xml utility to helm-toolkit

Adds "helm-toolkit.utils.to_xml" which generates xml from a map
hierarchy.  This allows for example parameterizing xml configs in the
native helm way via a values.yaml interface.

Change-Id: Ide3d48a2974e45e48cef5aadee2fa0ee6b3f5a8e

-}} {{- $_ := set $local "tags" list -}} {{- range $key, $value := . -}} {{- $pair := dict "key" $key "value" $value -}} {{- $tag := include "helm-toolkit.utils._xml_tag" $pair -}} {{- $_ := set maps are converted to xml, slices to comma separated lists, and anything else to its default string representation. */}} {{- define "helm-toolkit.utils._to_xml_embed" -}} {{- if kindIs "map" . -}} {{- include "helm-toolkit.utils.to_xml" . -}} {{- else if kindIs "slice" . -}} {{- join "," . -}} {{- else -}} {{- . -}} {{- end -}} {{- end -}} {{/* Takes a .key and arbitrary .value and returns an xml tag. */}} {{- define "helm-toolkit.utils._xml_tag" -}} {{- if kindIs "slice" .value -}} {{- $local := dict -}} {{- $_ := set $local "tags" list -}} {{- range $index, $item := .value -}} {{- $subtag := include "helm-toolkit.utils._to_xml_embed" $item -}} {{- $pair := dict "key" $.key "value" $subtag -}} {{- $tag := include "helm-toolkit.utils._inline_xml_tag" $pair }} {{- $_ := set $local "tags" (append $local.tags $tag) -}} {{- end -}} {{- join "\n" $local.tags -}} {{- else if kindIs "map" .value -}} {{- $subtag := include "helm-toolkit.utils._to_xml_embed" .value -}} {{- $pair := dict "key" .key "value" $subtag -}} {{- include "helm-toolkit.utils._expanded_xml_tag" $pair -}} {{- else -}} {{- $pair := dict "key" .key "value" .value -}} {{- include "helm-toolkit.utils._inline_xml_tag" $pair -}} {{- end -}} {{- end -}} {{/* Takes a .key and a .value string and returns an expanded xml tag. */}} {{- define "helm-toolkit.utils._expanded_xml_tag" -}} <{{ .key }}> {{ .value | indent 2 }} revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-05 16:56:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/dd130071ac652bcbe6fa85df887a19937de02d4e', 'message': "Bind openshift-master to the public network

address. This will allow users to access the cluster from outside the

Change-Id: Ib573758b515264d1dda90cc9de61f4fa6659dc7d
"}]
commit_message:
Bind openshift-master to the public network

It's ok to bind the HAProxy configs for openshift-master to the public
address. This will allow users to access the cluster from outside the
internal network. Openshift nodes will remain bound to the internal
network.

Change-Id: Ib573758b515264d1dda90cc9de61f4fa6659dc7d

commit_message:
Store ODL logs to file

ODL is configured to log to console and then access the logs
via docker logs. Older logs are being deleted too fast. So
moving back to logging to file which is default setting in ODL
THT.
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/
master/puppet/services/opendaylight-api.yaml#L60

Change-Id: I29724cfb23e13c8293d1b7b4341cbd409ae1b7a6
Closes-Bug: 1779629

commit_message:
Collect OVN databases logs

This patch is changing the tempest-post-common.yml file to collect
the logs from the OVN database as part of the jobs run.

The patch also enhances the networking-ovn DevStack plugin to allow
configuring the OVN database log levels and sets the level to DEBUG in
the tempest runs to help with troubleshooting problems in the gate.

Change-Id: Ib83524c705d88d0232b03bc3dc320430d21249bd

commit_message:
Update local.conf.sample to match stable/queens

This patch is adjusting the local.conf.sample file to match the
stable/queens release. Without these changes, using the
local.conf.sample file to deploy devstack will fail.

Change-Id: I139c85f25980f66dd8e88fadd060f62aee2558dd

commit_message:
Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd

Currently, as discussed in [1], the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that
the loopback interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1780065

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rabbitmq-server/+bug/1312507/comments/15

Change-Id: I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0
(cherry picked from commit 93fb7f08b8e1915ef594192984574f4f9613ccb1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/580460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # always allow ipv6 on loopback for rabbitmq, see +bug/1780065 net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6: value: 0

commit_message:
Don't trigger repo injection if nothing was built

Currently we have a few possible places for building package in
the job. It requires logic change in order to differentiate
between injection cases.
build-test-packages role can run and not to build anything bc of
various reasons, in this case we need to avoid running
install-built-repo role, that's why we set compressed_gating_repo
to empty string and check in every case if it's empty or not.
If compressed_gating_repo is emptry - we didn't built *last* time
anything, so nothing should run.
See also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576277/1

Change-Id: I7d768c5b550984cdd45d8a9cbbf89767e5e1c418
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/17/576417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Depends-On: Id15aec6324814a871e87f19f24999b0e3b8a8f05

commit_message:
Ensure Octavia created load balancer can be found

Until Octavia support for gets with filters is fixed, we need to
ensure we can find previously created Octavia LBs to avoid getting
InternalServerError from Octavia when executing the list function
with filters. Otherwise this will crash the lbaasv2 handler, and
after a few retries, it will also crash the kuryr-controller

Closes-Bug: 1778516
Change-Id: I10494b142803d8c32e09f970ecc4e87e68f2ebca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/44/579144/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: result = "" try: result = find(obj) except n_exc.InternalServerError: # NOTE(ltomasbo): Workaround until octavia supports get with # filtering. # Once https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001944 is # solved, it can be removed lbaas = clients.get_loadbalancer_client() response = lbaas.list_loadbalancers() for lb in response.get('loadbalancers'): if (lb['name'] == obj.name and lb['project_id'] == obj.project_id and lb['vip_address'] == obj.ip): result = obj result.id = lb['id'] result.port_id = self._get_vip_port_id(result) result.provider = lb['provider'] break if result: LOG.debug("Found %(obj)s", {'obj': result}) else:
deleted_lines: # TODO(yboaron): change the create/find order. try: except (n_exc.Conflict, n_exc.InternalServerError): result = find(obj) if result: LOG.debug("Found %(obj)s", {'obj': result})

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Change-Id: I3f12811684a49794bca87c4a10b18d45879da773
Closes-Bug: #1776375

commit_message:
setup.cfg: remove qinling console script

Individual qinling client is not ready yet as there isn't a
qinlingclient.shell module. This commit removes the entry from
setup.cfg to avoid a useless qinling console script being created.

Change-Id: Id456890bb180a692f74b8a4a858128ed6519a7de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-qinlingclient refs/changes/28/543428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

The change [1] that added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was
merged in Ocata and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.
This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I747f94cef06a037d19147b6c64f03c1ce08c8043
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/20/575320/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: ignore linter error for 'long' type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 22:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/storage/test_impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/a39833585c6f9e1787cbd5986ec329ea1ff5754f', 'message': "ignore linter error for 'long' type

The Python 2 type 'long' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check for the python version is already doing the right thing, but the
linter does not honor that check so tell it to ignore the line.

Change-Id: If7d49f043da01f94e9d18df7ef81c96ca08bd025
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore linter error for 'long' type

The Python 2 type 'long' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check for the python version is already doing the right thing, but the
linter does not honor that check so tell it to ignore the line.

Change-Id: If7d49f043da01f94e9d18df7ef81c96ca08bd025
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/29/573029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ids = [3, long(1), 0] # noqa

in Zaqar is lazy, it returns 201 or 204 in this case.

This fixes some additional tests that weren't covered in
commit 8e0dd9763aba67bb7094cf92312daeba8d087866.

Change-Id: Iec341c83cdd28d6db50b2e456d082431a62846af

commit_message:
Fix assert error during queue creating in ut

In some concurrent test case, the queue may be created
more than one time in the setup function. Since the queue
in Zaqar is lazy, it returns 201 or 204 in this case.

This fixes some additional tests that weren't covered in
commit 8e0dd9763aba67bb7094cf92312daeba8d087866.

Change-Id: Iec341c83cdd28d6db50b2e456d082431a62846af
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <zigo@debian.org>
Closes-Bug: #1777645

commit_message:
Remove default function_version in webhook resource def

Or the function_version of a webhook would be changed to the default
value when updating the webhook without providing the function_version
parameter. That's an unexpected result.

Story: 2002898
Task: 22862

Change-Id: I63ec211a8771a55d2b04caed1f66a405849cb201
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/85/580585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function_version = wsme.wsattr(int)

commit_message:
Add network-create to python-zunclient

This change adds network create support to the python-zunclient project
for the network-create command.

The zun command network-create is now:
    zun network-create --neutron-net <neutron_net> --name <name>

Change-Id: I2b1e21b098dabf668f37558a2e7c2cc776002b9c

commit_message:
Function Alias API: delete and update

This patch supports function alias delete and update API.

- Function alias delete
- Function alias update
- Unit test for the API

Change-Id: I8341ef2a60ef0696ffd2095281cbb7fae3b15f5e
story: #2002143
task: #19987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/95/576795/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The supported body params: @rest_utils.wrap_wsme_controller_exception @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, wtypes.text, status_code=204) def delete(self, alias_name): """Delete a specific alias. """ ctx = context.get_ctx() acl.enforce('function_alias:delete', ctx) LOG.info("Deleting alias %s.", alias_name) with db_api.transaction(): db_api.delete_function_alias(alias_name) LOG.info("Alias %s deleted.", alias_name) @rest_utils.wrap_wsme_controller_exception @wsme_pecan.wsexpose( resources.FunctionAlias, wtypes.text, body=resources.FunctionAlias, ) def put(self, alias_name, body): """Update alias point to the function version. The supported body params: - function_id: Required. Function id the alias point to. - function_version: Optional. Version number the alias point to. - description: Optional. The description of the alias. """ ctx = context.get_ctx() acl.enforce('function_alias:update', ctx) params = body.to_dict() LOG.info("Updating Alias, params: %s", params) values = { 'function_id': params.get('function_id'), 'function_version': params.get('function_version'), 'description': params.get('description'), } with db_api.transaction(): alias = db_api.update_function_alias(alias_name, **values) LOG.info("Alias updated.") return resources.FunctionAlias.from_db_obj(alias)

commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I43ee210311daf206bd7586eaf8592809d8c38678
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/34/580434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix `def _admin` keystone client factory with trust scope

When trust_id is defined, the factory is adding None
value for all project scope keys in kwargs to avoid
this auth parameters will be loaded from auth conf.
This patch add None value for missing domain scope
keys domain_id and domain_name too.

Change-Id: If7dd2e171178d8408ec9802671198c9cf74707e1
Closes-Bug: #1763327
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/59/560859/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Remove domain_id, domain_name, project_name and project_id, # since we need a trust scoped auth object kwargs['domain_id'] = None kwargs['domain_name'] = None
deleted_lines: # Remove project_name and project_id, since we need a trust scoped # auth object

commit_message:
tasks: tempest_install: Add conditional for PIP package installation

SUSE and CentOS use an empty list for the required PIP packages and this
breaks the role as follows:

fatal: [aio1_utility_container-efed904e]: FAILED! => {"attempts": 5, "changed": false, "cmd": "/usr/bin/pip2 install -U  ", "msg":
"\n:stderr: ERROR: You must give at least one requirement to install (see \"pip help install\")\n"}

As such, we need to check if the list is empty before we try to install
the PIP packages.

Change-Id: I67d54fafdbecc7d55de55cd30163105b6a997dac
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/55/580455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: tempest_requires_pip_packages | length > 0

commit_message:
Change ACL optmization strategy in the spec file

When we first wrote this design document, the strategy was to let
neutron-server work with old Address Sets and  create new Security
Groups modelled as Port Groups in OVN. However, that will make the
code unnecesarily complex and we should still provide a mechanism
to migrate from Address Sets to Port Groups.

This patch is changing the strategy by making sure that the migration
takes place upon neutron-server start if the underlying OVN schema
supports Port Groups. This way, neutron-server doesn't need to deal
with mixed modelled resources. The drawback is that we'll be delaying
a bit the start of neutron-server the first time we need to do the
migration but: 1) this will happen only once. 2) initial testing with
500 ports in 50 different networks with 5 SG rules takes around 8
seconds to migrate so it's reasonable.

Change-Id: I666a5ccc87101b559cd9ee4e95b7399d962e23fe
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/71/579571/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - If the schema supports Port Groups, then a migration task will be performed from an OvnWorker. This way we'll ensure that it'll happen only once across the cloud thanks the OVSDB lock. This will be done right at the beginning of the ovn_db_sync process to make sure that when neutron-server starts, everything is in place to work with Port Groups. This migration process will perform the following steps: * Delete all existing Address Sets in NorthBound database which correspond to a Neutron Security Group. * Delete all the ACLs in every Logical Switch (Neutron network). * Create the default drop Port Group and add all ports with port security enabled to it. * Create a Port Group for every subnet to allow DHCP traffic. and add the relevant ports to them. * Create a Port Group for every existing Neutron Security Group and add all its Security Group Rules as ACLs to that Port Group. We should eventually remove the backwards compatibility and migration path. At that point we should require OVS >= 2.10 from networking-ovn.
deleted_lines: - If when updating a port/adding new ACLs, it belongs to some Security Group which is still modelled as an Address Set, then we'll keep the old behavior (ie. applying the ACLs to its Logical Switch) for that Security Group. - When a port is deleted, if it still belongs to some Security Group being modelled as an Address Set, we'll have to remove it. We can eventually remove the backwards compatibility code by requiring from networking-ovn OVS >= 2.10 but we should provide some means to migrate existing Address Sets into Port Groups (for example, migrating those in batches from the maintenance thread and eventually drop this code).

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Change-Id: I3f12811684a49794bca87c4a10b18d45879da773
Closes-Bug: #1776375

commit_message:
Moving arguments(name,type) to mandatory section.

This patch is for the attributes [name,type] which were mandatory
options but showing in  optional attributes.Now name and type
attributes is changed to mandatory attributes.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak Mourya <deepak.mourya@india.nec.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Handle LM rollback error when detaching volumes from transient domain

When rolling back a live migration an attempt is made to detach volumes
from the destination domain before any underlying volumes are
disconnected. This will fail if the migration did not complete
resulting in the destination domain still being transient and as a
result unable to detach devices.

This change simply catches this error and ensures the call to disconnect
the underlying volume from the destination host is still made. As
MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION is 1.3.1 this change also handles both the < 1.3.3
and >= 1.3.3 versions of the error string associated with detaching
devices from a transient domain.

Closes-Bug: #1779300
Change-Id: I716ecaa7b31e7131dafddcc652366652577845e1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I76eced31caad9ac6a3bf3a71d1d08f51a4fdb75b

commit_message:
Undercloud specific volumes for mistral-executor container

This fixes the issue where the nova config was being mounted into the
mistral-executor, even though that is only needed for the undercloud.

The second parameter MistralExecutorExtraVolumes is provided so that
users can provide their own extra mounts without overwriting
MistralExecutorVolumes.

Once this mechanism lands, it can also be used to mount the extra
directories which CI needs to modify container images during
deployment, therefor this change is part of

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Change-Id: I88612465d87f24a42e78e5f87a2d6b44b9335b11

commit_message:
Run cinder's db sync only on bootstrap node

The sync_db variable (which is True only on bootstrap node) needs to be
passed to the ::cinder::api resource to ensure the db sync only happens
on the bootstrap node.

Closes-Bug: #1779112
Change-Id: Ib7fcafbe769aadfcc58323ba3a06fa28a80a488a
(cherry picked from commit 34810fc361e71cfabe5d8ad6e083c664af9120e8)
(cherry picked from commit 690bf10462d2ac922e8c22631320e359cba9698f)
Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/cinder/api.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_cinder_api_spec.rb

commit_message:
It allows to create floating IPs with parameters.

- It adds missing parameters to create_floatingip method:
  - port: is translated to port_id=port['id']
  - client: is used to create/delete returned floating IP
  - **kwargs: are forwarded as they are to client

- It deletes floating IPs on final cleanup even when created
  by other client than default one.

- It implements delete_floatingip method.

- It deprecates create_and_associate_floatingip and replace
  it with create_floatingip

Change-Id: I6588e09127ab76c972d690a728fb7c5bad77289c

commit_message:
Set compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume to False

* Currently python-tempestconf is going to heavy refactoring.
  In master, setting compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume
  is handled by tempestconf but in Queens and pike tempestconf-1.4 and
  1.3 is used which does not have the same feature and this review
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570159/ removed the same for all
  releases causing tech-debt, It will fix the issue.

* Earlier all volume_encrypted tests are skipped, it fixes the issue.
  as it requires barbican support, few jobs does not barbican.

Change-Id: Ic8a29694fdfa3bebc1c9094a25235c72b1412da3

commit_message:
remove AUTHORS file from git

The AUTHORS file is generated automatically by pbr as part of building a
package, so it should not be checked in to git.

Change-Id: I0094164f0d1c27dd0e5b18d8d4403e1a59411482

subject: remove ChangeLog from git
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-06 02:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['CHANGELOG'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/7f3ae706a6006144d2c9ab8965622c4bd4859604', 'message': 'remove ChangeLog from git

The ChangeLog file is automatically generated by pbr as the package is
built and does not need to be checked in to git.

Change-Id: I376fa93a0ffca99e4f4784dfc283b222b44800be
'}]
commit_message:
remove ChangeLog from git

The ChangeLog file is automatically generated by pbr as the package is
built and does not need to be checked in to git.

Change-Id: I376fa93a0ffca99e4f4784dfc283b222b44800be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/40/580540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: swift (2.18.0) * Added container sharding, an operator controlled feature that may be used to shard very large container databases into a number of smaller shard containers. This mitigates the issues with one large DB by distributing the data across multiple smaller databases throughout the cluster. Please read the full overview at https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_container_sharding.html * Provide an S3 API compatibility layer. The external "swift3" project has been imported into Swift's codebase as the "s3api" middleware. * Added "emergency mode" hooks in the account and container replicators. These options may be used to prioritize moving handoff partitions to primary locations more quickly. This helps when adding capacity to a ring. - Added `-d <devs>` and `-p <partitions>` command line options. - Added a handoffs-only mode. * Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the "replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication tasks. At most one worker per disk will be spawned. Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so operators can tell which messages came from which worker. The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message from the replicator's logger will have the prefix * The object reconstructor will now fork all available worker processes when operating on a subset of local devices. * Add support for PROXY protocol v1 to the proxy server. This allows the Swift proxy server to log accurate client IP addresses when there is a proxy or SSL-terminator between the client and the Swift proxy server. Example servers supporting this PROXY protocol include stunnel, haproxy, hitch, and varnish. See the sample proxy server config file for the appropriate config setting to enable or disable this functionality. * In the ratelimit middleware, account whitelist and blacklist settings have been deprecated and may be removed in a future release. When found, a deprecation message will be logged. Instead of these config file values, set X-Account-Sysmeta- Global-Write-Ratelimit:WHITELIST and X-Account-Sysmeta-Global- Write-Ratelimit:BLACKLIST on the particular accounts that need to be whitelisted or blacklisted. System metadata cannot be added or modified by standard clients. Use the internal client to set sysmeta. * Add a --drop-prefixes flag to swift-account-info, swift-container-info, and swift-object-info. This makes the output between the three more consistent. * statsd error messages correspond to 5xx responses only. This makes monitoring more useful because actual errors (5xx) will not be hidden by common user requests (4xx). Previously, some 4xx responses would be included in timing information in the statsd error messages. * Truncate error logs to prevent log handler from running out of buffer. * Updated requirements.txt to match global exclusions and formatting. * tempauth user names now support unicode characters. * Various other minor bug fixes and improvements. swift (2.17.0, OpenStack Queens) * Added symlink objects support. Symlink objects reference one other object. They are created by creating an empty object with an X-Symlink-Target header. The value of the header is of the format <container>/<object>, and the target does not need to exist at the time of symlink creation. Cross-account symlinks can be created by including the X-Symlink-Target-Account header. GET and HEAD requests to a symlink will operate on the referenced object and require appropriate permission in the target container. DELETE and PUT requests will operate on the symlink object itself. POST requests are not forwarded to the referenced object. POST requests sent to a symlink will result in a 307 Temporary Redirect response. * Added support for inline data segments in SLO manifests. Upgrade impact: during a rolling upgrade, an updated proxy server may write a manifest that an out-of-date proxy server will not be able to read. This will resolve itself once the upgrade completes on all nodes. * The tempurl digest algorithm is now configurable, and Swift added support for both SHA-256 and SHA-512. Supported tempurl digests are exposed to clients in `/info`. Additionally, tempurl signatures can now be base64 encoded. * Object expiry improvements - Disallow X-Delete-At header values equal to the X-Timestamp header. - X-Delete-At computation now uses X-Timestamp instead of system time. This prevents clock skew causing inconsistent expiry data. - Deleting an expiring object will now cause less work in the system. The number of async pending files written has been reduced for all objects and greatly reduced for erasure-coded objects. This dramatically reduces the burden on container servers. - Stopped logging tracebacks when receiving an unexpected response. - Allow the expirer to gracefully move past updating stale work items. * When the object auditor examines an object, it will now add any missing metadata checksums. * `swift-ring-builder` improvements - Save the ring when dispersion improves, even if balance doesn't improve. - Improved the granularity of the ring dispersion metric so that small improvements after a rebalance can show changes in the dispersion number. Dispersion in existing and new rings can be recalculated using the new '--recalculate' option to `swift-ring-builder`. - Display more info on empty rings. * Fixed rare socket leak on range requests to erasure-coded objects. * The number of container updates on object PUTs (ie to update listings) has been recomputed to be far more efficient while maintaining durability guarantees. Specifically, object PUTs to erasure-coded policies will now normally result in far fewer container updates. * Moved Zuul v3 tox jobs into the Swift code repo. * Changed where liberasurecode-devel for CentOS 7 is referenced and installed as a dependency. * Added container/object listing with prefix to InternalClient. * Added '--swift-versions' to `swift-recon` CLI to compare installed versions in the cluster. * Stop logging tracebacks in the `object-replicator` when it runs out of handoff locations. * Send ETag header in 206 Partial Content responses to SLO reads. * Now `swift-recon-cron` works with conf.d configs. * Improved `object-updater` stats logging. It now tells you all of its stats (successes, failures, quarantines due to bad pickles, unlinks, and errors), and it tells you incremental progress every five minutes. The logging at the end of a pass remains and has been expanded to also include all stats. * If a proxy server is configured to autocreate accounts and the account create fails, it will now return a server error (500) instead of Not Found (404). * Fractional replicas are no longer allowed for erasure code policies. * Various other minor bug fixes and improvements. swift (2.16.0) * Add checksum to object extended attributes. * Let clients request heartbeats during SLO PUTs by including the query parameter `heartbeat=on`. With heartbeating turned on, the proxy will start its response immediately with 202 Accepted then send a single whitespace character periodically until the request completes. At that point, a final summary chunk will be sent which includes a "Response Status" key indicating success or failure and (if successful) an "Etag" key indicating the Etag of the resulting SLO. * Added support for retrieving the encryption root secret from an external key management system. In practice, this is currently limited to Barbican. * Move listing formatting out to a new proxy middleware named `listing_formats`. `listing_formats` should be just right of the first proxy-logging middleware, and left of most other middlewares. If it is not already present, it will be automatically inserted for you. Note: if you have a custom middleware that makes account or container listings, it will only receive listings in JSON format. * Log deprecation warning for `allow_versions` in the container server config. Configure the `versioned_writes` middleware in the proxy server instead. This option will be ignored in a future release. * Replaced `replication_one_per_device` by custom count defined by `replication_concurrency_per_device`. The original config value is deprecated, but continues to function for now. If both values are defined, the old `replication_one_per_device` is ignored. * Fixed a rare issue where multiple backend timeouts could result in bad data being returned to the client. * Cleaned up logged tracebacks when talking to memcached servers. * Account and container replication stats logs now include `remote_merges`, the number of times a whole database was sent to another node. * Respond 400 Bad Request when Accept headers fail to parse instead of returning 406 Not Acceptable. * The `domain_remap` middleware now supports the `mangle_client_paths` option. Its default "false" value changes `domain_remap` parsing to stop stripping the `path_root` value from URL paths. If users depend on this path mangling, operators should set `mangle_client_paths` to "True" before upgrading. * Remove `swift-temp-url` script. The functionality has been in swiftclient for a long time and this script has been deprecated since 2.10.0. * Removed all `post_as_copy` related code and configs. The option has been deprecated since 2.13.0. * Fixed XML responses (eg on bulk extractions and SLO upload failures) to be more correct.
